name: HawaiianJungleHangout
host_about: Since venturing to the Big Island 20 years ago, I've always been drawn to the volcano, warm springs, and rainforest. As a documentary photographer for over two decades, the dozen different microclimates delight in an ever changing offering of surreal landscapes, diversity of character and faces, exotic/colorful fauna, and island politics, gives a profuse array of visual opportunities and is a photographer's paradise. I feel fortunate to have a home located minutes from all my favorite sites and love having the opportunity to share the experience.

name: Westin Maui Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas-1BR
neighborhood_overview: Maui's gentle climate and fabled surroundings are ideal for your relaxing, yet invigorating vacation experience. Nestled between the shimmering Pacific Ocean and West Maui Mountains, this resort is your pristine surfside retreat on Maui's beautiful North Kā‘anapali Beach. Rewarding days discovering Maui's boundless beauty and activity begin and end here.
host_about: originally from idaho, love traveling, work in tech. Feel free to contact me if you any any questions.

name: Comfy Waikiki Studio in Central Location Top Floor
neighborhood_overview:
Within walking distance of all the activities that Waikiki offers, shopping,restaurants,
bus stops, convention center (less than one mile) and fabulous Waikiki Beach. Nearby
street parking can be available.
host_about:
I am a graduate of USC, was on swim team and water polo, participated in water sports all my life.  Among my interests are swimming, body boarding, fishing and being near the beach.
Have been an athlete all my life, have many athletic events that I have participated in, including:
Iron Man, FINA World Swimming Championships (gold medalist), Oahu Canoe Racing Association with many state championships, veteran Molokai to Oahu Canoe Race, participant in Lanai to Maui channel swim and many other lifelong accomplishments.

I live off island most of the time, contact assistants for guidance.

name: 7 nights in Maui, Hawaii @ Ka'anapali Beach Club
neighborhood_overview: It's on a much less crowded section of the Ka'anapali Beach.
host_about: Ka'anapali beach, Maui, is a wonderful place to spend a week of your time in with your loved ones.

name: 1 block to  beach/ 30 day minimum  3 Beds!
neighborhood_overview: This is such a great neighborhood. It is family and kid friendly, and very safe. The neighbors are all wonderful and helpful.  And we have one of the most beautiful beaches, that's not crowded, just about 650 feet from the property. Ted's Bakery is only 3 blocks up the road. Foodland grocery store is 3 miles. There are several Foodtrucks within a 3 mile radius, also bike and beach Thai Food truck is a few blocks. Turtle Bay Resort is a 5 minute drive. gear rentals near by.
host_about: I love living a block from one of the most beautiful beaches in the world. I love to bike ride, hang out with my daughters and my friends.  I like to hike and see the many breathtaking views that this area has to offer. I love to read, if I have time.

name: Papaya 3: 3bdrm/1ba at Tiki Moon Villas
neighborhood_overview:
This is the country side of Oahu! You can watch the sunrise over the pacific ocean and hike to waterfalls, within walking distance from Tiki Moon Villas. Quiet, relaxing. Between January and May, whales are seen almost on a daily basis from the garden. Relax on secluded beach and be rejuvenated.

Enjoy Polynesian Cultural Center during the day and walk across the street to your home! No need for an hour drive back to Waikiki after the night show.
host_about: We live here on Oahu and have enjoyed hosting vacationers and locals alike at Tiki Moon Villas for over 10 years. We enjoy traveling, hiking and the ocean.....living next to one is a blessing we are grateful for every day, and we love sharing that with our guests.

name: Hale Hulili
neighborhood_overview: Very peaceful and relaxed.
host_about: I was born in Silver Lake, CA and still live there.  I am a small business owner who loves the Big Island of Hawaii.  I built 3 homes there so that I would have good reason to visit often.  When I built my homes I thought of what makes me comfortable when I travel and designed and furnished my them with that in mind.  It brings me joy for my guests to enjoy my hales - bringing joy is what they were built to do!

name: Ocean View Condo 4304 at Hanalei Bay Resort
neighborhood_overview: You will be staying in Hanalei Bay Resort in Princeville, Kauai. The neighborhood is very serene and quiet along the Princeville golf course with some houses, a few condo complexes, and resorts including the Westin and St. Regis. The resort has guests ranging from families with children to honeymoon couples, and sometimes family reunions or groups of friends. Princeville shopping center is the closest place to shop for groceries and check out some restaurants. There is also an Ace Hardware, a bank, yoga studio, and some island clothing shops. This is less than a ten minute drive - you can walk, but its about 2 miles away so it take a while. Driving into Hanalei takes about 15 minutes where you can enjoy the shops and restaurants in Hanalei Town, the Kauai Nut Roastery, and the town's favorite bar: Tahiti Nui. The best Hanalei beaches are down by here as well. There are surfboard and snorkel rentals in the town. There is also an organic foods shop.
host_about:
Bay Area native, back living in SF for the last few years. I love traveling and have also lived in China, Indonesia, Chile, Australia.

Kauai is amazing, and if you're going for the first time you I'm very excited for you! Our condo at Hanalei Bay Resort is perched with a spectacular view of the mountains and bay. Since I don't live on the island I won't meet guests in person, but work closely with our local property manager and the resort to ensure a wonderful stay. 

One thing to note about my listings here - you may notice each one has pictures of the same room. That is because it is! Our condo is a 3BR condo that can be rented as a 1, 2 or 3BR (the middle unit is the master suite with the kitchen and living room, and then there are 2 lockout - 1 on each side).

name: Beautiful 3 BD Home in Kapaa Kauai TVNC 1079
host_about:
Aloha,
  We are happy to share our home away from home with you on this magical island.
  We live in San diego, California, and split our time between both places.
The house is quiet, spacious and in a quiet neighborhood, on half an acre.
You will be greeted in the morning and early evening by a family of chickens who have lived near by for years.... if you are so inclined, we leave a tub of seed for guests to toss to them,  one of them comes right to the back door.  There are doves, cardinals and beautiful songbirds around as well, you will enjoy their sweet songs daily as you sit in the screened lanai for your morning coffee.
   We have been blessed with wonderful guests that have stayed in our home and we welcome you as well to this little piece of heaven.
  Dasan and Shakti
ps
our fav beach is Anini

name: 600 sqft FamilyStudio with Private Bath & Balcony
neighborhood_overview: Live like a local, stay at our home in an old and quiet established neighborhood.  Two blocks away from the mini mall on the highway.
host_about:
Aloha...  My daughter Natasha and I will be catering to your vacation needs in our super charming mid-century plantation home.  We are on Airbnb because we enjoy meeting people from all over the world, learning other cultures, sharing the wonders of our beloved island and extending our warmest Filipino-Hawaiian hospitality to everyone who walks through our door.  
A favorite quotation:" Do not forget little kindnesses and do not remember small faults".  
E komo mai, Nou ka hale !! ( Welcome, our house is yours !! ) 

Please scroll down to the Listings and check out all our rooms on Airbnb.... Click the picture of the room you like for more information.
.  .

name: TK's Hideaway
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is all new homes built seven years ago. We are at the very end of a super quiet culdesac with no thru traffic and a secluded patio with spectacular views. Ten minutes to beaches and golf. One hour to observatory and ninety minutes to Volcanoes National Park.
host_about: Here at home I enjoy water sports like bodysurfing, swimming, snorkeling and kayaks with the dolphins. Also, lots of golf. I also enjoy cycling. I enjoy swapping travel stories. When you get here I can help you get to where you want to go. I have guide books and can give you a few secret beach spots.

name: Condo in Kailua-Kona, Kona Coast II Resort 2bdroom
host_about: I am a retired general dentist  in Las Vegas after practicing in San Jose, CA and Las Vegas. When my family was young, we came to the Kona Coast Resort II each year and enjoyed the many amenities the resort has including the lush greenery, the golf course view, and the beautiful sunsets.

name: The Mango House near Pahoa, Big Island of Hawaii
neighborhood_overview: you are safe here from the recent lava flow. some of our old attractions are gone but still plenty to do in our hood.  Good eats in Pahoa and a couple cool farmers markets weekly.
host_about: The hosts and owners of Your Hawaiian Retreat are Hugh and Elvira Johnson. Hugh grows organic ginger and turmeric up the mountain and Elvira manages the retreat.

neighborhood_overview: Pahoa is alive and well with restaurants that follow all current protocols for prevention of the spread of covid.

name: Waikiki studio
host_about: Artist who tries to spend as much time in Hawaii as possible.

name: Papa'aloa Animal Lovers' Paradise #1
neighborhood_overview: Everything--the weather, the views, the peace & quiet.  Occasionally livestock make a bit of noise, but not much.  Good neighbors; not too close, which is nice.
host_about:
I'm a single retired police detective from Oahu. For 16 years I offered horseback rides on Oahu, but moved to the Big Island with my horses when the ranch lease recently expired. 

Originally from the Midwest, I did a stint in the military, which brought me to the islands in 1978.  My education includes an AA in Foreign Languages, a BA in Psychology and completion of a Master's program in Guidance & Counseling. 
 
I'm a Christian, who believes the good Lord brought me to this fantastic place.
I love the serene beauty and quiet of this location, and since the house is much larger than one person needs, wish to share it with traveling guests,  who will also enjoy its comfort and fabulous views.  Besides that, the horses still "eat like horses", even though they are no longer earning their keep!

As a pet lover, I would prefer folks who also like animals.  Because I have so many, I don't have a chance to travel much, although in the past I did get the opportunity to visit Spain, France, Switzerland  and England.  I was stationed in Florida & CA as well as Hawaii while in the military.   

I enjoy a variety of books and movies, preferably well-written and thought-provoking.  A good comedy is always appreciated, as well.  My social life now is mostly a weekly ladies' luncheon and music nights at the Fifties Café.

name: SUITE ALOHA - Play at the Beach
neighborhood_overview:
We live in Kailua Estates, a charming and established residential neighborhood. Downtown Kailua with an abundance of shops and restaurants and two of the most beautiful beaches in the world - Kailua and Lanikai Beach – are in walking distance.
Join the walkers, joggers, and bicyclists - we are an active beach town and our neighborhood reflects that.
host_about:
I was born and raised in Europe and have traveled the world.  For me, there is no place like the windward side of Oahu with its lush Ko’olau mountain range and pristine beaches.  
Adventures and attractions are plentiful; yet, it is incredibly peaceful at the same time and embodies paradise pure.  I am fortunate to call Kailua my home now.
My husband was born and raised on Oahu and our home is filled with Aloha.  We welcome you to experience this wonder.  Local knowledge will be freely shared :)

name: Lower level of quiet, private home, The Hula Hut!
neighborhood_overview: Close to the beach, top surf spots, bike path, and Ted's Bakery. Fabulous "Mother's Beach" one block away at Sunset Beach.
host_about: Active, like to meet people and try speaking other languages.  I like reading, hiking, biking, eating, and exploring.

name: Bamboo Heaven Maui Omaomao (Green) Room LLC
neighborhood_overview: Haiku is the neighborhood I grew up in. I love it! It is a small but growing community with still a lot of the old local families I know, and a lot of new neighbors moving in. We have a variety of restaurants from Japanese and Thai to American, Hawaiian, Vegetarian, Mexican, food trucks with Indian and Mediterranean food, and a Kombucha Bar with raw foods! There is a grocery store, a post office, hardware store, thrift shop, gift shop, pet shop, coffee shop, hair and nail salon, fitness center, massage. We are the home of Haleakala Bike Company, where you can ride a bike down from Haleakala Crater back to Haiku.  Another popular activity here is to watch the sunrise over Haleakala Crater. This is a good location to do that from. It is about a 1 1/2 hr. drive up to the crater, but allow 2 hours for traffic. So you will be setting your alarm to wake up about 3:30 am! A new rule has just been enforced, and you need to make a reservation ahead of time to see the sunrise! Only 150 cars are
host_about: I am a local Maui lady, born and raised here in upcountry Haiku.I love this community! Maui No Ka Oi means Maui is the best!  It is the most beautiful island!! I love watching my plants and trees flower and grow! I have 6 grown children who are having children of their own! I have 9 beautiful grandchildren whom I love dearly!! Most of all, I love Jesus, and He loves me!  "I can do all things through Christ, who strengthens me!"

name: Kepuhi Beach Condo with Loft  #2145
neighborhood_overview: KaluaKoi Resort, or Kepuhi Beach Resort, was built at the same time as The Sheraton Resort. Our section of condos were built with full  kitchens, the other half as hotel rooms with a restaurant, conference rooms, etc. The Sheraton has been closed for over 15yrs now but the grounds, pool, parking, etc. are fully maintained and kept up. This gives a very quiet, peaceful complex with endless coves and beaches to explore with very few people. In the condo is binder full of all activities, restaurants, and places to visit on Molokai. There is a small convenient store on premises by the pool that carries food, snacks, souvenirs, swim suits, etc. The closest large grocery store is 5 miles up the hill to the town of Maunaloa.
host_about:
Patrice and Rose, sisters, own the condo together that you would like to rent. We have been going to Molokai for over 20 years and honestly have to say we wish we lived there.  We love the solitude and peacefulness of Molokai, gives us both a break from our separate busy lives in California. 
We have used Airbnb for vacations to Florida and other great places and have always had great accommodations  and stays.
We have made sure that everything we feel is important to a comfortable, non cluttered, clean and well stocked condo is available  to you. We want you to feel like our condo is yours when you stay there, that would make us happy.

name: The Secret Garden Room
neighborhood_overview: We live three miles from the beach and close to shopping and restaurants. The Wailua golf course is minutes away and Smiths Tropical paradise and luau are also three miles away. Wailua River for kayaking, stand up paddle boarding and water skiing is three miles away. As for your accommodation we have close neighbors all around as we live in a subdivision but you’d never know it by the landscape on property. Our only pets are the koi fish in the pond and the birds in the trees and the usual nature creatures but no cats or dogs or horses here.

name: Inn Waimea- Banana Room
neighborhood_overview: We have your best guarantee of good weather on your trip!  15-20 inches of rain a year here while the other side gets 85.  If Kauai's Nature is what you are after, we've got you covered!  Our place is a Historic Inn that was originally constructed as a parsonage.  We provide clean and professional Suites with the feeling of times from the past.  Many of our guests enjoy the easy access to Waimea Canyon, Kokee Park, Amazing West Kauai Beaches, and many other of Kauai's Natural Gems.  Located one lot back from Black Sand Beach and Amazing Sunsets.  The in Waimea Town location makes walking out the front door to go to restaurants, shops, and grocery stores fun!
host_about: We are a property manager for the West Kauai area.  Please contact us regarding details about our units and or the surrounding area.  Mahalo

host_about: I have always enjoyed helping people and being in contact with people in meaningful ways.  My career as a nurse and now as a rental owner and host have provided me with numerous such opportunities for which I am very grateful.  I truly look forward to meeting you and serving as your host during your stay in our piece of paradise known as the Big Island of Hawaii!

name: Cozy 1-bedroom in Makiki-Punchbowl
neighborhood_overview: Although it's a very urban neighborhood, it's still friendly and slow-paced. We are on the slopes above Chinatown's shops and restaurants. host_about:
Just an Argentine living in Hawaii. 
Originally arrived here pursuing a career in Marine Sciences, but somehow became involved in raising a family and things got interesting. 
Until 2014 I was teaching Spanish as a foreign language, and dabbling in literature at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. We relocated to Seattle for a few years, but now we are back.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood around is good, most of the time is very quiet and safe.

name: Ocean View Condo 4306 at Hanalei Bay Resort
neighborhood_overview: You will be staying in Hanalei Bay Resort in Princeville, Kauai. The neighborhood is very serene and quiet along the Princeville golf course with some houses, a few condo complexes, and resorts including the Westin and St. Regis. The resort has guests ranging from families with children to honeymoon couples, and sometimes family reunions or groups of friends. Princeville shopping center is the closest place to shop for groceries and check out some restaurants. There is also an Ace Hardware, a bank, yoga studio, and some island clothing shops. This is less than a ten minute drive - you can walk, but its about 2 miles away so it take a while. Driving into Hanalei takes about 15 minutes where you can enjoy the shops and restaurants in Hanalei Town, the Kauai Nut Roastery, and the town's favorite bar: Tahiti Nui. The best Hanalei beaches are down by here as well. There are surfboard and snorkel rentals in the town. There is also an organic foods shop.
host_about:
Bay Area native, back living in SF for the last few years. I love traveling and have also lived in China, Indonesia, Chile, Australia.

Kauai is amazing, and if you're going for the first time you I'm very excited for you! Our condo at Hanalei Bay Resort is perched with a spectacular view of the mountains and bay. Since I don't live on the island I won't meet guests in person, but work closely with our local property manager and the resort to ensure a wonderful stay. 

One thing to note about my listings here - you may notice each one has pictures of the same room. That is because it is! Our condo is a 3BR condo that can be rented as a 1, 2 or 3BR (the middle unit is the master suite with the kitchen and living room, and then there are 2 lockout - 1 on each side).

name: Minutes from Kealakekua Bay - Pineapple Patch
neighborhood_overview: We are all on at least one acre lots. The space and distance is nice even though all of our neighbors are great.
host_about:
My partner Terry and I had been visiting South Kona from our home in Southern California for 16 years.  We finally broke down and bought our property on The Big Island of Hawai'i early in 2013.  We have a 30-tree mango orchard on our one-acre lot which sits about 800' above Kealakekua Bay.   We also own a lot very close to the property, and we are considering expanding the orchard.

We fell in love with South Kona and the expansive views of the coast and the sea - as well as the myriad of activities the area offers - ocean sports of all kinds, hiking, biking, running, etc.

I am retired and live on the property pretty much full time. Terry continues to run his own business and travels around the world.  We have a dog named Kona (we didn't name her - she came to us with that moniker!) who loves to play with tug toys.  If you visit, you'll see what we mean.

We are avid hikers, and I can steer you to some great spots near our property and around the island.  I study Hawaiian and Hawaiian culture at our local Community College, and I am becoming well-versed in matters of Hawaiiana.  I was a social worker, a therapist, a professor, a theatre director, and an actor.

We enjoy meeting new people and swapping tales of travels.  We love sharing our island with others.  Life is Good.  Come visit!

name: Inn Waimea- Bamboo Suite
neighborhood_overview: We have your best guarantee of good weather on your trip!  15-20 inches of rain a year here while the other side gets 85.  If Kauai's Nature is what you are after, we've got you covered!  Our place is a Historic Inn that was originally constructed as a parsonage.  We provide clean and professional Suites with the feeling of times from the past.  Many of our guests enjoy the "Front Door" access to Waimea Canyon, Kokee Park, Amazing West Kauai Beaches, and many other of Kauai's Natural Gems.  Located one lot back from Black Sand Beach and Amazing Sunsets.  The in Waimea Town location makes walking out the front door to go to restaurants, shops, and grocery stores fun!

host_about: Aloha!  My name is Anne Burmark.  Papakea Resort has been special to me since I first rented there in 1979 when I was teaching English. A student's parents owned a unit there. I had lived on O'ahu as a child, and the spirit of Aloha was everywhere for me on Maui. Papakea soon became an annual vacation spot. Wes and I married in 1997, and we bought our condo in 1998. It is our second home now, and we want your visits to be special, comfortable, and memorable in the very best ways.

name: Waikiki Marina Resort (2)
neighborhood_overview:
Sitting in the beautiful city of Honolulu, on the island of Oahu, Waikiki Marina Resort at the Ilikai offers a wide-variety of activities that everyone can enjoy.

From ancient stone heiau (Hawaiian temples) to 21st-Century high-rises, Oahu is an island of endless contrasts. Geographically only the third largest of the inhabited Hawaiian Islands, it is nonetheless home to nearly three-quarters of the state's 1.2 million residents — 370,000 of whom are concentrated in urban Honolulu the ultra-modern, south-coast cityscape kama'aina (residents) refer to simply as "Town."

But take a 45-minute drive to "Country" — the famed surfing Mecca on the island's north shore — and you'll find sleepy Hale'iwa town (pop. 2,225) existing much as it has since it was established by missionaries in 1832.

Geography like the other islands, islets and shoals that make up the 1,600-mile Hawaiian Island chain, Oahu is believed to be the product of a single "hot spot" in the eart

Welcome to Secret Falls Retreat.

Use Permit No. U-2015-14

 You can hear the water falls and depending on the weather, you can hike to them from our back deck.
 I am originally from CA, grew up in BC, Canada. 
I love the outdoors, have 3 children ages 13, 17 and 20. We are a family run operation and look forward to meeting you:).
Mahalo,
Darcy

host_about:

Of course our four grown children and our eight grandchildren have a sustained interest in a warm place to go to get a break from the long Canadian winters.

name: 3 BR/2 BA, Ocean View, AC -Kamaole Sands
neighborhood_overview:
Truly, what makes Kamaole Sands so desirable is the LOCATION.

Kamaole Sands is directly across the street from Kamaole III beach and beach park. Kamaole III is one of the nicest sandy beaches on Maui, popular with locals and tourists alike.

This beach is great for swimming, boogie boarding, snorkeling, sun worshiping, and whale watching (in season.) The large Kamaole III beach park is beautiful, clean, and well maintained, and is complete with facilities, outdoor showers, and children's playgrounds.

Its huge grassy area is perfect for all kinds of sports, and for enjoying the beautiful Maui sunset. There are many restaurants within walking distance, and just a short drive away is the town of Wailea and golf courses.
host_about:
Hello,

We enjoy living in Silicon Valley in the beautiful San Francisco Bay Area of Northern California.  We work in the high-tech industry, and when we have free time, our number 1 hobby is tending to our two children and our number 2 hobby is travel.  We have been very fortunate to go snowboarding every winter, and have traveled to far away places such as Europe, Asia, and Africa during the summer holidays.  Most importantly, we love going to Maui.  When we are not on Maui, we like to share our beach condo with travelers here on Airbnb.

Cheers,
Trent & Jenny

name: Charming Oceanfront condo with A/C  in Molokai, HI
neighborhood_overview: This is Hawaii in its purest image: one grocery store, one gas station and some tropical eateries, excursions to the west side with its pristine beaches miles after miles, learn about the history of the grand Kamehamea, original place of the hula dance, I like it all and I hope every visitor will share in the happiness this island has to offer.
host_about:
I'm a realtor in Las Vegas for a few years. I was raised in Germany and enjoyed traveling in many parts of Europe. My dream was to come to San Francisco, California , from where I later moved to Marin County before I moved to LV. I worked as an independent contractor for some of the major corporations before I changed my career to become a Realtor. I like traveling, reading, hiking, swimming, music, baking among other things.
I wish you a marvellous vacation! Come back again!

name: Romantic Secluded loft
neighborhood_overview:
Although this is a growing area, it still has quiet, natural surroundings with good-quality dirt roads and no street lights making it dark at night but allowing the view of the night sky to be spectacular.

Great place for taking long walks and exploring.

name: 2bdm Condo Kona Worldmark Resort
neighborhood_overview:
Greetings from Kailua-Kona, Hawaii, land of beaches and volcanoes. Spend your days lazing at the beach, shopping or driving out to Hawaiian Volcanoes National Park to see a live volcano in action. Nothing is too out of reach from the wonderful WorldMark Kona resort, including a public beach within walking distance.

Things to See and Do at Kailua-Kona
Kailua offers the best of the Kona Coast and a traditional feeling of aloha for visitors. The grounds where the great King Kamehameha spent his last days are now a national historic landmark. Just across a small inlet is Kailua Pier. It is the focus of water activity and the departure point for charter boats, diving, snorkeling and deep-sea fishing expeditions. On the opposite side of the bay is Hulihe'e Palace, built in 1838. It's now a museum offering glimpses into the time of King Kalakaua, who used it as a summer palace in the 1880s. Across the street from the Palace is Moku'aikaua Church, the oldest church in Hawaii, e
host_about:
Like you, I love to travel, including cruising. I love to help people. I love to be hospitable. I love to read, especially about the places I am about to visit in my travels and adventures.  My husband and I have visited most of the European countries, north and south, as well as: Turkey, Israel, Greece. Southeast Asia, and the Western Rockies of the United States and Western Canada. We have also visited the western shores of South America.

"What you know is a function of whom you choose to believe." This is my husband's (Ph.D.) saying. Of course, I believe it.

I just retired after thirty (30) years with one company. Now, I am enjoying sharing our  luxurious vacation resort (which has properties around the world and within the USA). Name any place on this globe, and I will try to help you make your dream vacation or travel experience come true. 

I am looking forward to hearing from you.

Thank you,

Lorie

name: Kolea Palms Guesthouse - 30 day minimum rental
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the original sugar cane plantation settlement of Ewa Beach.  While the guesthouse was built in the 90's, the main house-and many of the neighborhood homes--were built in the 1940's.  It's a unique, local neighborhood far enough from the tourist traps to feel like a home, yet everything on island is still within reach for fun day excursions.
host_about: Having spent years of travel in the military and as an international airline pilot, I've learned to appreciate the comforts of a home-style experience as opposed to the hotel scene.  As nice as some hotels are, they are still hotels.  When I travel for leisure, I enjoy booking a home.  If you share my appreciation for a home-style experience while traveling, then my guesthouse should suit you nicely.

name: Pono Plantation Maui-3 Bedroom Cottage
neighborhood_overview: Kaanapali Resort, the best vacation spot on Maui.  Snorkeling, turtle watching, surfing, zip-lines, restaurants, activities  galore. Located directly across from The Westin Kaanapali Villas and Duke's.  You are only 5 minutes to Lahaina Town

name: 1bdm-Condo Kona WorldMark Resort-
neighborhood_overview:
Things to See and Do at Kailua-Kona
Kailua offers the best of the Kona Coast and a traditional feeling of aloha for visitors. The grounds where the great King Kamehameha spent his last days are now a national historic landmark. Just across a small inlet is Kailua Pier. It is the focus of water activity and the departure point for charter boats, diving, snorkeling and deep-sea fishing expeditions. On the opposite side of the bay is Hulihe'e Palace, built in 1838. It's now a museum offering glimpses into the time of King Kalakaua, who used it as a summer palace in the 1880s. Across the street from the Palace is Moku'aikaua Church, the oldest church in Hawaii, erected in 1837 by the first group of missionaries.

name: 1Bdm- condo-sleeps4 Kapaa-WM Resort-
neighborhood_overview:
Kauai is so lush and green it’s known as The Garden Island.

And what a garden! Waterfalls plunge into pools lined with exotic flowers, rare birds call out their unique songs, and waves peel off in long sonorous lines that whisper and fade on unspoiled beaches.

It is a garden tailor-made for exploration. Check out the Wailua River where, during certain times of the year and specific tides, you can view ancient stone carvings. Or, hike the Na Pali Coast—a 14-mile stretch of uninhabited shoreline where 2,700-foot cliffs plummet to clear coral waters, and hidden valleys open on empty white-sand beaches.

My husband and I have visited most of the European countries, north and south, as well as: Turkey, Israel, Greece. Southeast Asia, and the Western Rockies of the United States and Western Canada. We have also visited the western shores of South America.

"What you know is a function of whom you choose to believe." This is my husband's (Ph.D.) saying. Of course, I believe it.

I live next door to the studio so I'm available for questions, tips, helpful advice about the island, etc.  I sell vacation ownership for Wyndham worldwide in Princeville as my profession or work.  I love to surf, motocross, and jetski in my spare time.  Please feel free to call on me any time if I can be of assistance.  You will really enjoy my accomodations and I'm certain you will have a wonderful time on your trip to Princeville, Kauai, Hawaii.

name: Kaanapali Royal Resort 1st Floor- Nr Ocean & Shops
neighborhood_overview: It's a great gated- location which is very close to the beach, Whaler's Village, Bar's and Restaurants.   Our location is not too close to the Freeway and has a great grass area directly outside of the lanai (patio).  Also, compared to most units in the complex, the unit is easily accessible with very few steps into it, as well as being close to the pool/bbq entry gate.   What makes it unique is that Kaanapali is one of the sunniest places on the Island.  Literally, it can be raining in Napali, and still sunny in Kaanapali.
host_about: We have two families with 3 kids each, who run and manage our Kaanapali Royal  Unit in Maui.  I am a  real estate appraiser who dabbles in property management, and a mom of 3 teenagers!  My hobbies are kayaking, Zumba,  and ball room dancing.

name: Beautiful Waikoloa Beach 2 Bedroom Villa in Hawaii
neighborhood_overview: Waikoloa Beach Colony Villas is a private, gated complex in the exclusive Waikoloa Beach Resort.  It is on Hawaii's Kohala Coast with the Big Island's best beaches and weather. Waikoloa Beach Colony Villas was awarded the Certificate of Excellence Award.  Waikoloa Beach Colony Villas is set among 22 acres of tropical landscaping and palm trees, and is right next to the 10th fairway of the Waikoloa Beach Golf Course.  You can also play tennis, work out in the air-conditioned fitness center, or relax at two tropical pools.  One of the two pools features a lava rock waterfall and spa and the other pool has a separate 18' deep children's area.

name: Pats at Punaluu studio cottage K-4.

George, a native Hawaiian, grew up in Hawaii on the island of Oahu. I have lived in Oregon for more than thirty years, but I return to Hawaii to visit family and friends as often as possible.
I have owned the cottage at Punaluu cottage  since the 1970's and the maui condos since 1990's. I am pleased to share this beautiful beach front units with you. I hope that you enjoy your stay on the magical island of Oahu or Maui.  Aloha and welcome!
Mahalo,

George Muffett

name: 100% Renovated with Amazing Views
neighborhood_overview: Ali'i Kai II is known in Princeville as one of the most quiet, peaceful, and immaculately landscaped complexes in the area, and our unit is in the building with the best location in the entire complex. We have an ocean view from our lanai (watch whales in season) and breathtaking jungle, mountain/waterfall views from the dining room, kitchen, master bedroom, and master shower windows. Ours is the only building with great views from both sides. Every other building has a parking lot or parking lot/pool view from the dining room, kitchen, master bedroom, and master shower windows. The cooling trade winds hit our condo perfectly. Also, the lanai's in our building don't face the direct sun, so you can comfortably sit out on the lanai all day long if you want to without overheating as you would in other buildings. Right outside the front door is a large greenbelt bordering a jungle canyon filled with tropical birds which sing the most beautiful songs each morning and afternoon. We are also

name: Home away from home 2 Br Apt w Stunning Mountain
Jo's Hamakua Seaview Getaway
neighborhood_overview:
Our home is located in the once bustling plantation town of Pa'auilo, about 40 minutes north of Hilo, 10 minutes from Honoka'a, 25 minutes south of Waimea, 30 minutes from Waipio Valley, 40 minutes from Waiakoloa and over an hour away from Kona.
It is one of many villages along the Hamakua coast line. Where sugar cane was once harvested and plentiful, diversified agriculture and eucalyptus fields remain. Hamakua reaps the benefits of high rainfall providing for the lush landscape but remarkably has the most temperate climate of any region on the Big Island.
Due to its rich volcanic soil, the Big Island produces some of the highest quality agriculture in the state. Coffee, macadamia nuts, and papaya are just a handful of its world reknowned crops. The Hamakua region itself is home to numerous waterfalls and specialty produce farms like mushrooms and vanilla. Waimea and its rolling hills houses the largest privately owned ranch in the country Parker Ranch; with access t

Marilyn is originally from Kailua, Oahu, Hawaii and is a dental hygienist who has been working in her profession for 35 years, 31 of them on Maui. We've been married for over 20 years. name: 2bdm WorldMark Resort -LaHaina-Maui
neighborhood_overview:
To explore the wondrous playground that is Maui, let’s start at the top and work our way down. Maui’s Haleakala Crater stands two miles above sea level. Hiking trails reveal a landscape of charred rock, cinder stacks and ash—more a moonscape than a place you’d associate with Earth. From there, head down the slopes into rain forests that ooze with Garden of Eden visions—400-foot waterfalls, tropical streams bordered with native trees such as ’ohi’a, ’olapa and kolea, and warm turquoise pools that invite an invigorating swim. Next, glide along the surface of the ocean on a surfboard or catamaran then dip below to greet a whole new world. Here, brilliant colors are the norm. It’s like diving into your own private "National Geographic" episode.

Day done—dig your toes into the sand, listen to the music of the waves and let your cares float away.
Things to See and Do at Valley Isle
Maui offers more than breathtaking views, sunrises, sunsets and landscapes that take you f

name: Makai Hale 1 House off Waimanalo Beach + BBQ +AC

We have vacation rental homes in Waimanalo and Kailua. My husband is a woodworker in Waimanalo and builds furniture using Hawaiian hardwoods: koa & monkey pod. We have two daughters who ride horses, surf, do tae kwon do, and generally enjoy the Hawaiian lifestyle.

name: Rocky Point Day Dream monthly
host_about: I am born and raised in Sunset Beach on the North Shore of Oahu. I love the ocean, surfing and body surfing. Our family loves to travel. Favorites spots always have the ocean near by like South of France, Australia, South Africa, California, Canada, Portugal, Spain, Tahiti. Of course there is no place like home on the North Shore. I am so happy to be able to share our home  and this special place with visitors and friends.

name: Oceanfront condo on secluded beach!
neighborhood_overview:
Makaha is the complete opposite of Waikiki, but only an hour away from it. It's a very small town and not over populated like other parts of the island. Well known for some of the best surf on the planet. Lots of great restaurants to eat live entertainment on the weekends. Farmers markets, and hikes in the area. Golf course in view of the condo.

There's a Costco / Safeway, and shopping centers on your way in (25mins away). Disney resort and others are 20mins away with all new shopping center, and classy restaurants. Airport 45mins away. Kailua, Kaneohe, & North shore are both an hour away.


Come get a piece of some old school Hawaii. If you're not into the city life and just want to relax in private, this place is for you!
host_about:
38yr old entreprenuer that lives and born on Oahu Hawaii. Love the ocean and anything to do with the water. Very family oriented.
- Always treat people the way that you want to be treated

name: Perfect coast or volcano with AC
neighborhood_overview:
Quiet residential neighborhood one block off main highway. Ten minute drive to coast. Shopping center five minutes. Large Sunday farmers market nearby. 15 minutes to quaint Hilo and airport. Ten minutes to 1960’s Pahoa.
Getting around is by car so location is important.
host_about: I am a 40-year resident of Brooklyn with a real estate business in Manhattan and Brooklyn.  I am hosting because I like to share my space in Brooklyn, which doubles as my office and personal space, one in Manhattan, where I have created a special 1-BR for rental, and in Hawaii, where I spend time vacationing.  I find it enlightening to meet new people and make them feel at home in New York City and Hawaii.

name: Family-Friendly North Shore Paradise
neighborhood_overview: We are in a quiet neighborhood known for watching out for each other. Friendly polynesian neighborhood surrounded by local vegetation of breadfruit, banana, coconut, and plumeria trees.  Ocean access is located seven houses down the street. Beach access is a short walk or 1 minute drive. Popular activities for beaches include beachcombing, snorkeling, boogie boarding, surfing, and paddleboarding.
host_about: We have five children and love to travel and study about the places we see as a means to educate our kids. We enjoy art, nature, good food, and conversation with new people from all over the world.

The activities are endless when it comes to staying on The North Shore of Oahu. name: Botanical World Garden Home
neighborhood_overview: We are on the historic Hamakua Coast of the big Island. Our rain forest neighborhood is shared with the World Botanical Gardens and Botanical World Adventures. A stroll mauka (toward the mountain) and you will see amazing waterfalls and Mauna Kea views occasionally covered with snow! A stroll across the gardens and you can visit a waterfall in an intimate setting likely used by ancient Hawaiians. Just a few feet away cross a bridge with gorge views of Lower Umauma Falls. Further upstream is another historic bridge and the Umauma rapids. On another stroll you can go to the Hakalau Gorge Bridge over Hakalau Beach Park. Continue down to the beach below on an additional half mile hike.

name: Kailua's Premier Private Luxury Beach Bungalow
neighborhood_overview: Just walk out your door and down your beach path to Spectacular Kailua Beach - 10 minute walk to Kailua Town (which has fabulous restaurants and shopping),  5 minute walk down the beach to Kalawapi market and cafe - 5 minute walk to bike rentals, kayak rentals, stand up paddle boards, etc.

name: Kailua Lanikai Ocean View with hot tub
neighborhood_overview: Lanikai is a special neighborhood. Known as one of the best beaches in the world for its white sand, pristine waters, snorkeling and islands off shore. It's a great place to snorkel. Many people run or walk the Lanikai Loop. Go into Kailua Town for breakfast, lunch or dinner, then retreat to your paradise.
host_about: I love the ocean, desert and the mountains. Traveling is a big part of our life, so we know what makes a place comfortable, and also know how to leave a place clean and nice, with respect for others. We love America and are so proud of our beautiful parks and monuments. I look forward to hosting and staying with great new friends from Airbnb!

name: * Blue Wave
neighborhood_overview: Blue Wave sits along the famous bike path that runs from Sunset Beach to Waimea. Located about 1.5 miles from beloved Ted's Bakery, there are also loads of excellent food trucks close by for everything from acai bowls to fish tacos. Formal dining options are located at nearby Turtle Bay Resort, as are two premier golf courses. Snorkeling is fantastic at Sharks Cove, which is less than one mile down the road, and hiking trails abound. We haven't mentioned waterfalls yet! Waimea Falls and the rain forest is about a mile down the street. The charming and friendly surf town Haleiwa is close by for shopping, galleries and more fish tacos.

neighborhood_overview: Super nice family neighborhood home on a dead end street.  Please drive slowly, as there are children sometimes on our 1 car street.   Also, if arriving later than 9PM,  keep the noise level down.   Be cool to the neighbors!
host_about:
Aloha...  My daughter Natasha and I will be catering to your vacation needs in our super charming mid-century plantation home.  We are on Airbnb because we enjoy meeting people from all over the world, learning other cultures, sharing the wonders of our beloved island and extending our warmest Filipino-Hawaiian hospitality to everyone who walks through our door.  
A favorite quotation:" Do not forget little kindnesses and do not remember small faults".  
E komo mai, Nou ka hale !! ( Welcome, our house is yours !! ) 

Please scroll down to the Listings and check out all our rooms on Airbnb.... Click the picture of the room you like for more information.
.  .

name: 1Bdm-sleeps4 WM-Kapaa-Kauai Resort
neighborhood_overview:
Kauai is so lush and green it’s known as The Garden Island.

And what a garden! Waterfalls plunge into pools lined with exotic flowers, rare birds call out their unique songs, and waves peel off in long sonorous lines that whisper and fade on unspoiled beaches.

It is a garden tailor-made for exploration. Check out the Wailua River where, during certain times of the year and specific tides, you can view ancient stone carvings. Or, hike the Na Pali Coast—a 14-mile stretch of uninhabited shoreline where 2,700-foot cliffs plummet to clear coral waters, and hidden valleys open on empty white-sand beaches.

Helpful HintsKauai is so lush and green it’s known as The Garden Island.

And what a garden! Waterfalls plunge into pools lined with exotic flowers, rare birds call out their unique songs, and waves peel off in long sonorous lines that whisper and fade on unspoiled beaches.

It is a garden tailor-made for exploration. Check out the Wailua
host_about:
Like you, I love to travel, including cruising. I love to help people. I love to be hospitable. I love to read, especially about the places I am about to visit in my travels and adventures.  My husband and I have visited most of the European countries, north and south, as well as: Turkey, Israel, Greece. Southeast Asia, and the Western Rockies of the United States and Western Canada. We have also visited the western shores of South America.

"What you know is a function of whom you choose to believe." This is my husband's (Ph.D.) saying. Of course, I believe it.

I just retired after thirty (30) years with one company. Now, I am enjoying sharing our  luxurious vacation resort (which has properties around the world and within the USA). Name any place on this globe, and I will try to help you make your dream vacation or travel experience come true. 

I am looking forward to hearing from you.

Thank you,

Lorie

name: 1bdm-sleeps4 WMResort -LaHaina-Maui
neighborhood_overview:
To explore the wondrous playground that is Maui, let’s start at the top and work our way down. Maui’s Haleakala Crater stands two miles above sea level. Hiking trails reveal a landscape of charred rock, cinder stacks and ash—more a moonscape than a place you’d associate with Earth. From there, head down the slopes into rain forests that ooze with Garden of Eden visions—400-foot waterfalls, tropical streams bordered with native trees such as ’ohi’a, ’olapa and kolea, and warm turquoise pools that invite an invigorating swim. Next, glide along the surface of the ocean on a surfboard or catamaran then dip below to greet a whole new world. Here, brilliant colors are the norm. It’s like diving into your own private "National Geographic" episode.

Day done—dig your toes into the sand, listen to the music of the waves and let your cares float away.

name: Hale ‘Amakihi
neighborhood_overview: Hale ‘Amakihi is located in a semi-rural, residential neighborhood in Hawaiian Paradise Park.  There are no stores or restaurants in the immediate area.  We are about 7 miles from Pahoa and Kea‘au where there are many varied restaurants and stores.  We are also less than 20 miles from Hilo and 30 miles from Volcano.  The nearby coast has rugged lava rock cliffs with magnificent sea views and wonderful trails and country roads for hiking and running. Farmer’s markets, state and national parks, orchid nurseries, swimming beaches, natural hot ponds, and tide pools for snorkeling are all within an hour or less by car.
host_about: Although I love my cozy home, I am an avid traveler and enjoy fun adventures & learning about the world.

host_about:
After spending the past 24 years in Southern California, my wife Marie Claude and I are now settled in Provence part of the year and return to our second home in San Diego for several months each year.
We would be pleased to host you for a month when we travel to France in our comfortable duplex 2-bedroom conveniently located in the University Town Center of La Jolla, San Diego, or for a week in our luxury 2-bedroom, 1-bedroom or studio timeshare at the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort in Maui.

name: Step Into Serenity
neighborhood_overview:
Tucked away from everything....but a close commute to everything! Whether it's swimming, snorkeling, beach combing, horseback riding, ATV riding, hiking, exploring every nook and cranny of the island, taking in unparalleled beauty, sampling from O'ahu's diverse and delicious cuisine, you are in a convenient location from which to launch the day's activities. Just one mile up the road, the picturesque 153-acre Kualoa Regional Beach Park offers sweeping mountain and ocean views, picnic lawns, and beach access, while Kualoa Ranch & Zipline, a 4,000-acre private nature reserve and working cattle ranch, offers a plethora of activities: horseback riding, ATV riding, zip-lining, and tours of Hollywood film locations.
For a literal and delicious taste of Aloha, you'll want to visit
Tropical Farms Macadamia Nut Farm, just up the road from the vacation home, which began years ago as a simple roadside store and is now a quaint farm with a shop selling macadamia nuts, coffees, cho
host_about:
Born and raised in western Massachusetts, about as far away as one can possibly be from Hawai'i and still be in the United States, I arrived on O'ahu for a one-month vacation in 1980…but Hawai'i is hard to get out of one's system and I stayed to make Hawai'i my new home state. I’ve been exploring and loving the islands, people, and culture of Hawai'i for nearly four decades. I bought my first property on O'ahu in 1983, and during the 45-day escrow period, I earned my State of Hawai'i real estate license. Just two years later, I purchased the company I’d been working for; upon selling that business in 1986, I began and built my company, Fidelity Properties, from the ground up.  I purchased this beautiful (undeveloped) property in 1989 and built my home and the rental home and, over the years, I've nurtured the 'aina (land).  I enjoy swimming,  boating, and staying active.  Most importantly,  I am happy to share this paradise with you. 

Why this property?  "Keep the COUNTRY country."  You will see intermittent signs along the road on your way to the home.  The village of Waikane is in "the country"  away from the developed and more congested and populated areas of the island, and residents would like to keep it that way!  Here, there are flower farms and  and fruit trees.....a little bit of yesteryear and a country road that hugs the shoreline and takes you along an incredibly scenic drive along the windward coastline and onto the North Shore.  The quiet, windward side of O'ahu, from Kahuku to Kaneohe, is renowned for its lush vegetation, breezy trade winds, spectacular beaches, friendly little towns, and laid-back lifestyle.  With just about everything close at hand and several convenient avenues to Honolulu as well as the North Shore, it is no wonder I fell in love with and chose windward O'ahu, backdropped by the dramatic Ko'olau Mountain range, for my home and business base.  The nearest town is Kane'ohe, only a 15-minute drive, where you will find a variety of restaurants and shopping, a newly-expanded mall, movie theaters, and grocery stores.  

An acre of oceanfront, prettily landscaped with palm trees, flowers, and a lily pond, offers tranquility at the water's edge (the 'ae kai).....Sit and relax:  your view is the Chinaman's Hat sitting in the calm bay and the Ko'olau's rising steeply.  Forget your cares, feel anxiety slip away, savor the serenity.....

name: Renovation!  True oceanfront Views! 2BDR 2Ba
neighborhood_overview: The city of Kihei has it all.  Great restaurants, different beaches to explore, restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, flea markets, post office and more.
host_about:
Paul and Joan currently reside in Spring Branch, Texas and summer in Minnesota.  Prior to that they have lived in San Diego, the Philippines, Maryland, Virginia,  Albuquerque, New Mexico, Corpus Christi Texas and West Virginia.   Paul was lucky to have spent two years on Oahu as a child. A medical meeting on Maui rekindled the passion for Hawaii. They love to visit the different beaches, snorkeling, kitesurfing (Paul), and relaxing on the lanai - especially the mornings and sunsets.
    After exploring all the condos in Kihei we chose the Maui Sunset for it's ambiance, impeccable grounds and pool. Everyone was so friendly. When we first walked into the condo we ultimately purchased we were left breathless by the view, and knew it was the right one. Our beach is never crowded and perfect for daily walks and paddle boarding.  The central location of our condo makes it easy for us to explore the rest of Maui.
      We keep our condo equipped the way we like to enjoy it. We've taken care in updating our condo with modern features. Our guests appreciate these touches and all the amenities we leave for them to enjoy. Joan loves to cook, and we always have dinner parties with friends when we visit. Most days we take small half-day trips to enjoy all that Maui has to offer. By late afternoon we love to soak in the pool and hot tub, read, and talk with our friends (old and new). We cook most of our meals in the condo or outside on the BBQs.  We can share our favorite restaurant choices with you.  Our sunsets from the lanai are awesome.   Morning coffee and tea out on the lanai and watching the West Maui mountains illuminate with the rising sun never gets old with us.

name: Princeville corner unit for 5; Ocean, Sunset, Golf
host_about: Aloha. We live on Kauai, family has been offering vacation rentals there since the 60's & we vacation in Brian Head. Suzanne is the Owner/Broker of Beach and Bluff Realty.  She is a Realtor, vacation rental manager, and artist on Kauai; daughter, wife, mom and grandma. We have been renting vacation rental houses on line since 1999 following the family tradition of renting beach houses in Hanalei since the mid '60s. We fell in love with Brian Head as a mellow family ski /board resort and became owners there. We value our guests' precious time on vacation and strive to make each vacation a happy carefree memory. We have many many returning guests, some of whom become 'ohana (family.) Whether you are a guest on Kauai or in Brian Head Utah, we welcome you to stay with us and experience Hawaiian Hospitality. Brian Head is our other go to place in the world. We love that it is beautiful all year, friendly and non-pretentious. We love traveling through the 3 West coast states and the Rocky Mountain states. We love exploring, cooking, dining & wine tasting. We also really enjoy music, native cultures, art, and geology where ever we travel. (It is no wonder why we love Utah!) Of course we are always happy to come home to our home island of Kauai. No place I would rather call home.

name: Ocean View Loft -Own Private Hot Tub
neighborhood_overview:
We are located in Maui Meadows, a diverse and eclectic neighborhood, much like Hollywood Hills and Malibu. Our neighbors are artists, musicians, and other professionals.

You are staying in one of the sunniest places on the island! It very rarely rains in Kihei, but because we get water from Upcountry, it remains green and beautiful.

The nearest beach is Keawakapu, located 1 mile away, and perhaps Maui's best swimming beach. This is one of many white sand beaches on Maui, and it includes free public parking and showers. Keawakapu connects to other long beaches, which is good for swimming, boogie boarding, snorkeling or just laying out in the sun.

Rentals are available nearby Keawakapu for snorkeling gear, stand up paddleboards, kayaks, surfboards, and bikes.

Numerous other world-famous beautiful white sand beaches are within a 10-minute driving radius, such as Makena Big Beach, Little Beach Wailea Beach, Maluaka Beach, Po’Olenalena Beach, P
host_about:
I am a writer and executive coach / mentor / consultant.  I moved to Hawaii in December 2009 after living in Los Angeles since 1988.  

My partner and I enjoy nature, optimistic outlooks on life, travel, and getting to know great new people.  For traveling, we can go completely first class or rough it by camping out in remote areas.  We spend a lot of time in British Columbia and love the Pacific Coast of North America.

Our life motto is:  Before taking any action, decide what is BOTH the smartest AND most loving choice - and then do that!

name: Hale Wa’a - 2 bed/2 bath - 5 minute walk to beach!
neighborhood_overview:
Whether you decide to rent a car or use public transportation, our central location makes it easy to get around to the hottest spots in Honolulu.

The main roadway in Oahu, as well as the bus stop, are a short 2 minute walk from our house as is a beach.

The neighborhood is very secure and safe so you can be at ease walking around at any time of the day.

There is also a children's playground with a huge field that is a couple minutes walk away from the guest house.

The closest mall is Kahala Mall which is minutes from the house and has a Whole Foods, Starbucks, various eateries, and multiple retail outlets. All are not more than a 5-10 minute drive or bus ride.

*Kahala Shopping Center - 5 minute Drive, 7 minute Bus Ride

*Waikiki - 15 minute Drive, 25 minute Bus Ride

*Ala Moana - 15 minute Drive, 35 minute Bus Ride

*Diamond Head Hike - 10 minute Drive, 22 minute Bus Ride

*Hanauma Bay -
host_about:
Hello Everyone!

My name is Quinten and I was born and raised here Oahu. I graduated from Loyola Marymount University in 2015 in LA with a degree in Entrepreneurship and International Business. I worked as an English Language teacher for a bit here in Oahu while helping my mom renovate the guest house we are now offering on Airbnb.

I personally shy away from the beaches here ironically, but I do know the right spots to go; its inevitable to go to the beach growing up and living here. I also have many good recommendations for hikes, places to eat, and other sightseeing spots.

The best part about running a vacation rental thus far has been introducing our guests to our cats, dog, and turtle.

I am also still hoping to challenge a guest in a ping pong match as we have a table in our main house.

I'm also somewhat of a connoisseur of anime so I would love to hear any shows you are a fan of as well :D

Our Studio 24 Offers Cleanliness and Confidence

As our guest, we want you to book with us knowing that we’re taking cleanliness very seriously and feel confident that you can count on our studio to be 100% ready for your arrival.

host_about: As a photographer I (Lori) am living in the best place imaginable.  As a person who loves people, I am living in the best place imaginable.  As a person who enjoys warm tropical evenings, I am living in the best place imaginable.  I think you've guessed it -- I love living in Hawaii.  And more specifically, on the Kona side of the Big Island.    What I love most about being an Airbnb Host is YOU . . . my guests who come from all over the world.  My life is so much richer because of the wonderful people I've met and come to know.  I look forward to meeting new people and enjoying the return of those who've visited before.

name: 3 BR/3BA, Gorgeous View - AC - South Maui
neighborhood_overview:
Truly, what makes Kamaole Sands so desirable is the LOCATION.

Kamaole Sands is directly across the street from Kamaole III beach and beach park. Kamaole III is one of the nicest sandy beaches on Maui, popular with locals and tourists alike.

This beach is great for swimming, boogie boarding, snorkeling, sun worshiping, and whale watching (in season.) The large Kamaole III beach park is beautiful, clean, and well maintained, and is complete with facilities, outdoor showers, and children's playgrounds.

Its huge grassy area is perfect for all kinds of sports, and for enjoying the beautiful Maui sunset. There are many restaurants within walking distance, and just a short drive away is the town of Wailea and golf courses.

Hello,

We enjoy living in Silicon Valley in the beautiful San Francisco Bay Area of Northern California.  We work in the high-tech industry, and when we have free time, our number 1 hobby is tending to our two children and our number 2 hobby is travel.  We have been very fortunate to go snowboarding every winter, and have traveled to far away places such as Europe, Asia, and Africa during the summer holidays.  Most importantly, we love going to Maui.  When we are not on Maui, we like to share our beach condo with travelers here on Airbnb.

Cheers,
Trent & Jenny

I want my guests to experience the same love I have for this beautiful place and have an unforgettable stay.

name: Unique Apartment in excellent location close to
1200 feet above Kealakekua Bay, South Kona
neighborhood_overview: There are many activities in our area.  We’re located directly above Kealakekua Bay and Honaunau . . . both boast what is undoubtedly some of the best snorkeling in all of Hawaii . . . Lots of live reef, fish, turtles, and dolphins frequent the areas.  There are many great restaurants within a 3 mile radius of us, both casual & more high-end.  Kailua-Kona is 12 miles to the north of us . . . close enough to head in for some of the great restaurants or more touristy things, but far enough away to get a good feel for the "Real Hawai'i".  The beaches of the Kohala coast are between 45 minutes & just over an hour to the north, and Volcanoes National Park is an hour & 45 minutes around the south side.
host_about:

name: 5 Minute Walk to Kailua Beach
neighborhood_overview: The unit is located in a tranquil and safe neighborhood that is only a short distance to the beach and to the center of Kailua town.

name: Maui Ocean front condo
neighborhood_overview: West Maui has five Championship golf courses and exceptional ocean activities.
host_about:
George, a native Hawaiian, grew up in Hawaii on the island of Oahu. I have lived in Oregon for more than thirty years, but I return to Hawaii to visit family and friends as often as possible.
I have owned the cottage at Punaluu cottage  since the 1970's and the maui condos since 1990's. I am pleased to share this beautiful beach front units with you. I hope that you enjoy your stay on the magical island of Oahu or Maui.  Aloha and welcome!
Mahalo,

George Muffett

name: 1bdm-sleeps4 Kihei- Maui WM Resort
neighborhood_overview:
Resort Overview
Maui is now a little easier to visit. Your resort is located just off the Piilani Highway in the up-and-coming town of Kihei. This places it about 20 minutes from the airport. It has all the amenities you’ve come to expect, with the added benefits of being in Hawaii and just across the street from the beach.

When you arrive on Maui, you'll discover an island composed of two volcanoes, white-sand beaches, quiet villages where the residents still speak Hawaiian and colorful, bustling tourist centers. While there, you can watch for whales, golf at some of the world’s best courses, coast down a volcano on a mountain bike, tour a pineapple plantation, take a catamaran to a neighboring island, or tour Maui by helicopter. And don’t forget snorkeling, shopping, tennis, windsurfing, hiking, bodysurfing, scuba diving and horseback riding! Be warned—there’s so much to do, you’ll want to spend an extra week in Kihei.
host_about:
Like you, I love to travel, including cruising. I love to help people. I love to be hospitable. I love to read, especially about the places I am about to visit in my travels and adventures.  My husband and I have visited most of the European countries, north and south, as well as: Turkey, Israel, Greece. Southeast Asia, and the Western Rockies of the United States and Western Canada. We have also visited the western shores of South America.

"What you know is a function of whom you choose to believe." This is my husband's (Ph.D.) saying. Of course, I believe it.

I just retired after thirty (30) years with one company. Now, I am enjoying sharing our  luxurious vacation resort (which has properties around the world and within the USA). Name any place on this globe, and I will try to help you make your dream vacation or travel experience come true. 

I am looking forward to hearing from you.

Thank you,

Lorie

name: Aulani DVC Deluxe Studio Ocean View 7/4 week
Hawaii 509 at the Mana Kai Maui Resort
Cozy Room,  Private Entrance and Private Bathroom
neighborhood_overview:
Our spot is located in a quiet neighborhood centrally located along the South Shore; a great base from which to explore the island, without the hassle and crowd of Waikiki.

Our home is within biking distance to several trails. Google "Biki Bikeshare" to learn how to use the great local bikeshare program. TheBus (O'ahu's public transit system) has several convenient routes nearby and we are a short 10 minute walk from the University of Hawaii, Manoa.
host_about: I love playing in the ocean and I'm a big fan of mindfulness meditation!

name: Ocean View Wailea Townhouse 2BR, 2.5 ba
host_about: My wife and I are professionals.  We bought our Maui property in 2012 and use it personally several times a year. Is a great place!!

name: Waikiki Studio With Kitchenette Rm 601
neighborhood_overview:
Waikiki Beach is arguably the most renowned beach in the entire world. Even local Hawaiians venture out to enjoy Waikiki's beauty and mingle with the tourists.
Famous for its picturesque white sand beach, there is plenty of swimming, sunbathing and water activities to be had. Beginning surf lessons are easy (yes, you can probably surf on your first lesson!) There's also boogie boarding and paddle boarding close by. For the milder experience, large sections of the beach are protected by seawalls and make the water calm and safe for anyone young and old!

Easy Access to All Things Waikiki :
Starbucks two blocks away
Cheesecake Factory six blocks away (always busy)
PF Changs nine blocks away
Honolulu Zoo across the street
Honolulu Aquarium three blocks away
Diamond Head Crater Park twelve blocks away (cab or bus recommended)
Waikiki Shell three blocks away (special concerts and events)

Tour Buses; pickup one block away
Pea

name: 1bdm-sleeps-4 Kapaa - Ocean Front Resort
neighborhood_overview:
Perfect sunsets, unspoiled tropical beaches and cascading mountains surrounded by swaying palm trees are just steps from your oceanview balcony. Pono Kai offers 11 beachfront acres teeming with amenities including a long stretch of sandy beach, beautiful outdoor pool, saunas and whirlpool.

Centrally located in Kapaa on the east coast of Kauai, you’ll enjoy year round fishing charters, catamaran cruises and windsurfing. You can also catch seasonal whale watching, dolphin and sea turtle spotting expeditions. Close to championship golf courses, the resort is within walking distance to restaurants, shops and clubs.

Regional Highlights
A multi-hued patchwork of scenery collides with the calming waters of the Pacific Ocean and beckons visitors to islands almost wholly volcanic in origin. Great stretches of lava beds stream from the dramatic fireworks of restless Kilauea and Mauna Loa, and glistening beaches reflect glorious rainbows and spectacular Hawaiian sunsets

name: 2 Bdrm Condo at Makai Club Cottages
host_about: Hello! After many years of vacation club and property ownership, we have had the opportunity to appreciate how extremely convenient and comfortable these style stays can be for all types of travel. As our family has grown, we've found that we have more than we need and are able to utilize every year which lead us to start offering our properties at a great deal to others! With years of experience, our knowledge has allowed us to help others enjoy their vacations and make life long memories. We've been able to grow the services we offer into a business that now also manages multiple different owners with various types of ownerships!  We are happy to be in a place where we can help both owners and vacationers, so don't hesitate to ask for what you need - even if it is not directly listed! We can often book multiple units and/or offer nearby locations. Booking multiple condos at one of our resorts is one of our favorite ways to get family and friends together. Whether you are celebrating or simply spending time together with friends or family, book with us for your next vacation -  Traveling only expands one's horizons!

name: Oceanfront Puamana Townhouse
neighborhood_overview: Puamana is a gated community south of Lahaina.  The 30 acre community is well kept with lush gardens and tropical landscape.

name: Waikiki Beach apartment with Diamond Head views
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quiet and the building is family friendly, and conveniently located near public transit, the beach, and Honolulu Zoo.

name: Ocean Escape
host_about: Hawaiian Hideaways LLC has been in business since 2003.  We offer vacation rentals on the island of Oahu.  We have 18 properties in our inventory and many more thru our colleagues.

name: Marriott's Ko Olina Beach Club studio OV
Kealakekua Bay Haven - Loke Lanai, Steps from Bay
host_about: I love people and the wonderful Hawaiian people and village of Napoopoo that we live in.  My husband and I built this house together with the help of talented fellow villagers and we have been renting it out ever since.  Growing up our home was known as the "Greenwood Hotel" as the door was always open and the light was always on in the hall-and all were welcome, still is and still are.  Life Motto--Treat others the way you would like to be treated.

name: Beautiful Garden Guest Suite
neighborhood_overview: We are centrally located to so many great places. Our property is in a clean and quiet residential neighborhood. We're also on a hill that affords much more comfortable temperatures than down in the lava fields ;)
host_about:
Hello,  

Since my parents, Dave and Marlies, have decided to enjoy a Hawaiian lifestyle full time, I have taken over their Airbnb unit. I am eager to continue to uphold their standard for keeping a clean and comfortable place to stay.

But I'm not just a host, I'm a traveler too. As a guest, I am quiet and respectful, as if I am at my own home. 

Aloha!

-Gina

name: Special Room For a Family (PRWG)
neighborhood_overview: We love that we live in one of the most beautiful places on Earth. Known as the "7 Mile Miracle," the North Shore of Oahu is one of the most sought after places for vacationers. We're lucky enough not only to live steps away from world class beaches, surf breaks, and historic Haleiwa town, but we are a serene getaway amongst all of it.
host_about: Aloha! I am the proprietor of a private lodging on the North Shore of Oah'u, a place where you will find an escape from the everyday, relaxation, and some of the most beautiful beaches in the world. Here at my home you enjoy the beautiful weather, lush jungle surroundings, and the way the sunlight glistens off the Pacific.

name: Hawaiian Condo Suite
neighborhood_overview: Close to everything. This is a prime location right next to the ocean and generally the sunniest part of the island ;)
host_about: Love Hawaii!  Married since 2015. Enjoy the beauty the world has to offer through experiencing other cultures. Life is short; Live it Well.

name: NEW! CONVENIENT CENTRAL KAPOLEI WITH POOL ACCESS
neighborhood_overview: This is a desirable newly developed master planned community in the heart of kapolei. Safe, quiet and conveniently located. Anything you need is nearby. Newly opened are 7 eleven, Starbucks with drive thru and gas station, just a minute away.
host_about:
Aloha from Hawaii where I was born and raised, fishing and golfing is how I spend my free days. Hawaii is like no other place on earth, I wish everyone could experience the best of what Oahu has to offer so what's better than having a host who knows Oahu like the back of their hand. 
I look forward to hosting you, Mahalo

name: Bamboo 1: 1bdrm/1ba at Tiki Moon Villas
host_about: We live here on Oahu and have enjoyed hosting vacationers and locals alike at Tiki Moon Villas for over 10 years. We enjoy traveling, hiking and the ocean.....living next to one is a blessing we are grateful for every day, and we love sharing that with our guests.

name: Temple Lane Studio
neighborhood_overview: Laie is a family friendly neighborhood! Attractions include the Laie Hawaii Temple less then 80 yards away and Brigham Young University Hawaii a couple blocks away. A visit to the famous Polynesian Cultural Center is a must as well as many beautiful northshore beaches, including the famous Waimea Bay.
host_about: Laie Hawaii resident, native Hawaiian, mother of 4 awesome children. My husband and I have known each other since elementary school and were raised in and by the community of Laie! We love Hawaii and are happy to share with you Laie, our home!

name: Heart of Waikiki, 2 Bed, 2 Bath, 1 stall, AC.
neighborhood_overview: The condo is situated in the middle stretch of Waikiki with easy stroll to most attractions:  Waikiki Beach, gift and amenity shops, restaurants, department stores, activities and nightlife, but located by the Ala Wai Canal, with beautiful canal and mountain view.  You may find it unnecessary to rent a car for the whole duration of your stay.
host_about: I am an active grandmother retired in paradise.  I am renting out our unit for my retirement income.  I hope you will enjoy your stay in my unit.

neighborhood_overview: This property is located on the world famous North Shore.  We are situated on the ocean front with a beautiful beach right down a few stairs.

name: Singing Bird
neighborhood_overview:
The advantage of the area is it is close to shops, beaches, boating and
biking activities. But do take the time to explore the island. Waikoloa resort
is a 10-15min. drive down the hill.
host_about:
I am retired young lady. I  have lived in Hawaii since 1974.  I fell in love 
with the people and the islands beauty.  I have always loved the mountains and water, and the bonus here are the flowers.  I myself am crippled due to 
a hospital stay, but can walk.  I enjoy animals and have lots of pets. I like to swim, snorkel, and sail.

I want you to visit the island and enjoy the serine atmosphere yourselfs.

name: Large Home, Minutes from Beach-Jacuzzi & Ping Pong
neighborhood_overview: This home is located in one of the best areas of South Kihei. A short walk to Maui's best beaches, including Kamaole I, II III, and Keawakapu Beach and four different parks. Also nearby are Shops and restaurants of Wailea and South Kihei.
host_about: Married with 2 children. Solar PV Contractor.  Loves to Bike, Surf & Go Boating.

name: Home of ALOHA, 1bdrm, HI Kai, w/ukulele lesson!
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is very safe and located just minutes away from beautiful beaches, including Hanauma Bay.  We are also very close to Koko Marina, where one can find many places to eat, shop, bank and even visit the movie theatre!  We recommend Bubbies Homemade Ice Cream and Desserts and also Kokonuts Shave Ice & Snacks for first time visitors! There are great places to hike that are within walking distance!
host_about: I am from the Island of O’ahu, born and raised! My husband and I have been married for 33 years and have 4 grown daughters, ranging in age from 20 - 32 . . . We also have a 7 yr old granddaughter.  I love to bake, cook, hike and read.  We both love to travel and sit in little cafe’s, sipping on lattes!

name: Ocean View, up to 6 people, 2 min from the beach!
host_about: I work as a web developer in LA based company

name: SUITE SUNSET BEACH Steps away FROM BEACH !!!
neighborhood_overview: We are in perfect location near the most beautiful and important beaches in Hawaii like Sunset beach, Pipeline and Waimea. Supermarkets, restaurants, food trucks are very close to our house, you will have wonderful days in this paradise !!!

name: Large Apartment at Marriott Ko Olina Beach Club
host_about: Welcome to my world of hospitality, where every detail is carefully crafted to make your stay unforgettable. As a seasoned host with years of experience in the industry, I understand that it's the little things that make all the difference. That's why I'm dedicated to providing you with a truly unique and exceptional experience that will leave you feeling pampered and relaxed.

name: PUNAHELE HALE
host_about: I am kanaka maoli who is knowledgeable in Hawaiian Kingdom political history from the time of Kamehameha I thru the present.   The stories of the past helps us to make wise decisions for the present and future........You will learn some of Hawaii's history when staying with me.

name: Perfectly located for coast and volcano
neighborhood_overview:
Neighborhood is Orchidland Estates, a peaceful, safe residential area of mostly 3-acre lots. Aulii Steet is a main route to the interior of Orchidland but aside from a couple of hours during weekdays there is little traffic.

House is one block off Rte 130 with short hop to either Pahoa or Keaau or Hilo, the main town. The ocean is 10 minutes by car., volcano 25 minutes.
host_about: I am a 40-year resident of Brooklyn with a real estate business in Manhattan and Brooklyn.  I am hosting because I like to share my space in Brooklyn, which doubles as my office and personal space, one in Manhattan, where I have created a special 1-BR for rental, and in Hawaii, where I spend time vacationing.  I find it enlightening to meet new people and make them feel at home in New York City and Hawaii.

name: Pupukea Paradise
neighborhood_overview: Minutes down the road, endless ocean activities await. In the summertime enjoy snorkeling, swimming, kayaking, SUP, diving and sometimes small wave surfing. In the winter come enjoy world class waves at the most beautiful beaches in the world including Pipeline, Waimea Bay and  Sunset Beach. Pupukea also has numerous hiking and mountain biking trails.

Four Seasons Hualalai 3Bd/3Bth - Ltd Winter $995

Ann, your host, serves as a psychologist at Brown University, while her husband is a physician trained at Yale and currently serving in the US Army. Nestled among a community of middle-aged professionals, this neighborhood stands out for its peace, safety, and warm ambiance.
