name: North Shore Hawaii Rocky Point Surf Beach private
neighborhood_overview: The Rocky Point neighborhood is at the center of The Seven Mile Miracle is that stretch of Oahu's north shore which boasts many of the world's greatest surf spots,including Waimea Bay, Sunset Beach and "the standard by which all other waves are judged" Banzai Pipeline.
host_about: Aloha! I'm a Teacher and an Artist, Living and Loving my Life on the North Shore of Oahu.

name: Beachside  private studio  Steps to surf and sand
neighborhood_overview:
The immediate area is a mixed density, family, active, seaside neighborhood. You will see many residents biking, jogging, fishing, enjoying Aweoweo Beach Park with their families, and carrying surfboards of all sizes.
There is a collection of unique shops in the converted Waialua Sugar Mill, which is a great place to pick up souveniers and gifts.
Located a few minutes north east is the bustling town of Haleiwa where one can find eateries of all kinds. Grab a shave ice, some locally roasted coffee, or a snack, and cruise all the unique shops. Or, if it is adventure you are craving -there are numerous places to rent boards, or kayaks, get some surfing lessons, or go on a Shark Boat. Or, a short drive further west will bring you skydiving and horseback riding.
And most of all, please find the time to explore all the beauty that the Seven Mile Miracle has to offer. From sun bathing to surf contests, hikes to gorgeous sunsets, we are sure you will make beautiful memories h
host_about: We traveled quite a bit, domestically, as a child, from Hawaii, to the mountains of Colorado, the Everglades of Florida, to sailing the Bahamas in a catamaran my family built. I have continued this love of new places as an adult as an avid "road tripper", and cherish the experiences one can have with the locals in each new place. Which is why we love to share our love of Hawaii with travelers. :)

name: DORMITORY STYLE
neighborhood_overview: We love that we live in one of the most beautiful places on Earth. Known as the "7 Mile Miracle," the North Shore of Oahu is one of the most sought after places for vacationers. We're lucky enough not only to live steps away from world class beaches, surf breaks, and historic Haleiwa town, but we are a serene getaway amongst all of it.
host_about: Aloha! I am the proprietor of a private lodging on the North Shore of Oah'u, a place where you will find an escape from the everyday, relaxation, and some of the most beautiful beaches in the world. Here at my home you enjoy the beautiful weather, lush jungle surroundings, and the way the sunlight glistens off the Pacific.

host_about: Born and raised in Hawaii, I love to do anything outdoors. Beach volleyball is my favorite thing to do in my spare time. Travel is a close 2nd :)

name: Princeville Paradise Home w/ AC - 4 BD 3.5 BA Home
neighborhood_overview: The Princeville area of Kauai is one of the premier places to vacation in both Hawaii and the entire world. Princeville is home to world class beaches, golf courses, surfing, tennis, walking paths and so much more. Albert Road is a quant residential community with friendly neighbors that will enhance your time in Kauai.
host_about:
My wife and I fell in love with Kauai when we first visited in 2001. My amazing wife had just run the Honolulu marathon and we were looking for some well deserved rest and relaxation. Not only did we get the R & R but we were captivated by the magic of the people and island of Kauai. From that point forward, we visited Kauai multiple times and ultimately decided that we want to retire in majestic beauty of Kauai. 

In 2018, we realized our dream and were able to purchase MELE MAKANI HALE, which translates to Wind Song. The trade winds will tickle your senses and fulfill your spirit with aloha. Although retirement is several years away for us, we are proud to welcome you to our hale and share in the magic and beauty of Kauai.

We hope that you enjoy our beautiful home and that you too, fall in love with all that Kauai has to offer.

name: COZY IN-LAW UNIT ACROSS FROM THE BEACH!!!
host_about:
My motto is "Life is short.  Eat dessert first."  Hopefully, it's organic chocolate!  After dessert, I love to stay healthy by eating all foods organic.

I love to travel, and my favorite thing to do while traveling is to eat local food, explore culture and art, and scuba dive.  I have been to Bali twice, Australia twice, New Zealand, Mexico, Caribbean, West Indies, and Europe.  I'm a movie buff, and especially love science fiction movies.

When I have free time, you'll most often find me at the yoga studio, or watching live music.  My favorite music is good ole rock n roll, and especially Motown.  Al Greene, Marvin Gaye, and Smoky Robinson are a few of my favorites!  Then of course there's the Beatles, Rolling Stones, Tom Petty, Eric Clapton, Crosby, Stills, and Nash, and many more!

I am spiritual, not religious and love to do meditation.

name: Luxury Resort Living - Maui Kanapali Westin Resort
neighborhood_overview:
Perched on twenty-six lush acres with breathtaking views of the Pacific Ocean and the islands of Lana'i and Moloka'i, Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villas (commonly referred to as WKORV) provides the ultimate in pampering and relaxation. Enjoy an afternoon unwinding beside any of the several lagoon style pools while your children are encouraged to open their minds to new worlds of culture, crafts, and fun at The Westin Discovery Center and pirate ship pool. Experience the luxurious 10,000 square-foot Spa Helani by Westin Heavenly Spa, dedicated to your sense of wellness. Obtain optimal fitness at one of the fully equipped Westin Workout facilities on property. Discover what’s cooking at any one of the three restaurants on property or enjoy indulging gourmet options at either one of the fresh markets.

This beachfront resort not only offers a multitude of ocean water sports such as snorkeling, kayaking, and surfing, but is also just minutes from the historic whaling town of La

name: Special Ocean View/Ocean View with Free Beach Gear
neighborhood_overview:
Location
This is a relatively quiet location in Waikiki, but convenient to everything – restaurants, shopping, attractions and of course beaches.

The Ilikai Marina is on the edge of Waikiki, so, compared to the congested middle of Waikiki, it is much easier to get out to downtown Honolulu and the other attractions of Oahu.

Beaches and Lagoons
The 2 choicest beaches of Honolulu are right next to you on either side. The Ilikai walkway drops you right on the lagoon at the start of the nicest part of Waikiki Beach.

The lagoon has had a recent, $13 million make over. The water is refreshed daily and it is surrounded with beach. It has a very shallow sloping entry, making it ideal for swimming, stand-up paddle boarding, kayaking and floating.

This is the start of Waikiki Beach. From here, you can walk all the way to Diamondhead. This section, Duke Kahanamoku beach, named after the legendary Hawaiian surfer and swimming champion, has b
host_about:
Aloha and welcome to our beautiful condo in Waikiki!  We are experienced vacation rental hosts. We have rented our our condo on Oahu for several years and also represent a few other units there as well. 

We love to travel and have visited over 40 countries world-wide, so we know what it is like to be a well-cared for (or not!) guest. So, we will do our best to help you to have an easy and enjoyable reservation and vacation. 

Looking forward to hearing from you and helping you to have a fantastic vacation. 

Warmest Aloha Regards, 
Carola and Robert

name: Oceanfront condo-Dolphins, Turtles, Sunsets oh my!
neighborhood_overview:
Just a couple of miles down the road from the famous Makaha Beach, home of the annual Buffalo's Longboard Surf Classic. This area is uncrowded, non-touristy and authentically local! As in other popular places, you may see homeless areas and abandoned vehicles. The State of Hawaii does its best to deal with these challenges.

To the east is the beautiful Makaha Valley, with its lush green mountains.
Enjoy a rustic beach hike a Ka'ena Point and see the seabird sanctuary and monk seals, or take a stream-fording jungle hike in the Makaha Valley.

name: QK Haiku Ohana
neighborhood_overview: This is a place of seclusion, listen to waves over the cliff.  Great for running and biking.
host_about:
My name is David. I am a Canadian, IT entrepreneur with businesses in Japan, Hong Kong and Hawaii. I enjoy travelling, adventure, learning something new every day, exploring life, be surrounded as much as possible by nature, new technologies and as well as modern/heritage and contemporary art. That's why I recently bought this house in beautiful Lions Bay British Columbia for my family to get together as well as to share with people from all over the world. 

You will find peace and privacy in my QK (play on "relax" in Japanese) house as it is quiet and serene with many breathtaking views. 

Designer home which offers three, spacious bedrooms, a large kitchen, open living room and bar area, and multiple sea view decks.

Each bedroom has a private ensuite bath and TempurPedic beds, with bamboo sheets, that can accommodate kingsize or single configurations.

Fully equipped kitchen, outdoor BBQ, cable TV, wireless internet, laundry facilities and parking.

This location offers complete privacy while being close to recreational and social activities in Lions Bay; to the south, Horseshoe Bay and West Vancouver; to the north, Squamish and Whistler.

I look forward to welcoming you into the house and share all the best that beautiful Lions Bay village has to offer!

name: **NEW: Cottage near Volcanoes National Park
neighborhood_overview: Volcano Village is a small artists’ community located just outside of Hawai‘i Volcanoes National Park. At 3000 to 4000 feet altitude, the town of Volcano and most of the Volcanoes National Park enjoy a cooler climate.
host_about: Aloha, my name is Janet and I've been fortunate to call the big island home for decades. I moved from Maui and fell in love with this island. The big island is so diverse from incredible white, black and green sand beaches to rain forests to snowy mountain tops in the winter. This is nature at its finest. I look forward to welcoming you to Kilauea Lodge and helping you plan a wonderful stay on this amazing island.  E komo mai, welcome.

name: One Bedroom Condo at Makai Club Resort
neighborhood_overview: The Makai Club Resort is located on the stunning North Shore of Kauai, and is right next to the Makai Golf Club. The accommodations at the Makai Club Resort include cottages and condominiums, which are either one or two bedrooms. Some rooms offer views of the Makai Golf Club, and all are close to a number of top Kauai beaches. The Makai Resort also has an outdoor pool and hot tub, and all rooms have a lanai patio. The Makai Club Resort is in the perfect location for exploring Princeville.

name: Makana Kai (Seaside Gift) Gated Community Condo
neighborhood_overview:
Located in one of the most sought after resorts in Hawaii, this ground floor 2 bedroom, 2 full bath garden condominium with lanai and garage parking is right in the heart of the gated Ko Olina Kai golf course community. It is short walk or bike ride to the Disney Aulani resort and spa, four famous public lagoons, and shops and restaurants. Close enough, but not too close to Honolulu, nearby Kapolei has all the big name shopping you need, and the Honolulu airport is just a 20 mile freeway trip away. Meanwhile, you can relax and enjoy the lagoons and local boutique hotels and restaurants and Aulani Disney Resort & Spa.

Welcoming guests from all over the world, this private home has wonderful access to four protected lagoons for swimming, snorkeling and diving. Please note: this is strictly a no-smoking/no-vaping of any substance inside or outside property due to severe health consequences for staff and family. If you smoke or vape this property won't work for for you.

neighborhood_overview: Volcano Village is a small artists’ community located just outside of Hawai‘i Volcanoes National Park. At 3000 to 4000 feet altitude, the town of Volcano and most of the Volcanoes National Park enjoy a cooler climate.
host_about: Aloha, my name is Janet and I've been fortunate to call the big island home for decades. I moved from Maui and fell in love with this island. The big island is so diverse from incredible white, black and green sand beaches to rain forests to snowy mountain tops in the winter. This is nature at its finest. I look forward to welcoming you to Kilauea Lodge and helping you plan a wonderful stay on this amazing island.  E komo mai, welcome.

name: Dlx. Ocean View Maui Studio...Updated/Great Views!
neighborhood_overview:
Ideal west Maui location in Kahana...only 5 min. north of famous Kaanapali Resort. Walking
Distance to shops/restaurants in the area and great beaches minutes away
Perfect locale to base yourself and then explore the island....

name: Luxury Home in Gated Community
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighborhood with long time residents.

name: Paddle On Inn
neighborhood_overview:
All of our units require us to block out a full month for each reservation -
So we approve or decline based on the total revenue the owner will receive , determined by the number of guests and number of days reserved -
Typically we are looking to net at least half of a normal monthly rate -
Smaller units rent for less than larger and some complexes are less than others.

name: Waikiki Banyan Apt., Walk to the Beach
host_about: I work as a web developer in LA based company

name: Oceanside Convenient Beautiful 2 bedroom Condo
host_about:
Born and raised in Kailua Kona, Hawaii.  I enjoy the outdoors, especially the beautiful blue water at my back door.  Swimming and fishing with my 10 Year old daughter are my favorite things to do.  
I am continuing to improve everything in the condo to make your stay memorable.  Should you have any suggestions or comments I can be contacted through Airbnb.
Aloha,
Cory

name: 30 night +, A/C, Airport, Beach, Fast Wifi
neighborhood_overview:
ALOHA!

Das Beach house is conveniently located minutes from the Kona International Airport in the Kona Palisades.

From the airport, our home is literally 3 turns, and minutes away.

The closest beach is Kohanaiki or Pine Trees- about 2 miles away! (Pine Trees Cafe- one of our favorite local spots for local food is on the way)

Families will truly appreciate Costco and other local eats, less than 10 minutes from our home.

Golfers will appreciate proximity to world renown courses 15 minutes away .

Downtown Kailua-Kona is about 15 minute drive. On the way you will find numerous restaurants, shops, and breweries.

Onsite- we have provided a book that has some of our recommendations for restaurants, breweries, and beaches listed.

The Hilton Waikoloa and Kua Bay are about a 20 minute drive, with beautiful turquoise water and white sandy beaches.

Kealakekua Bay has some of the worlds best

name: Mazie's By The Sea
neighborhood_overview:
There is a local public beach about a block away (walk down the beach) which is a great area for picnicking. White Plains is a great family beach with lifeguards and is about ten minutes away.

Ka Makana Ali'l, the area's new Mall hosts great Shops and a new theater with reserved seating and recliner seats.

For the traveling healthcare professionals:

The Queen's Hospital West Oahu is 5.9 miles away.

Hawaii Pacific Health - Pali Momi Hospital is 12.4 Miles away.

Tripler Hospital is 18.2 miles away.

The Queens Hospital Punchbowl is 22 miles away.

The commute to/from Honolulu during rush hour is 90 minutes on a good day.
host_about: I grew up in a small mountain town in New England and in the earlier years we watched Magnum P.I.  as the evening entertainment. I am fortunate to find myself living on the Pacific Rim with my wife and our child and occasionally I even wear an Aloha shirt to work. We enjoy volunteering and there is never a dull weekend given the many events that Oahu has to offer. Our mainland friends and family love to come to visit us, although I suspect living near the beach might have something to do with it....

name: Kohala Ranch with pool and Ocean view
neighborhood_overview: We are Located on the exquisite North Kohala coast on the Big Island of Hawaii, the gated community of Kohala Ranch encompasses more than 3500-acres and consists of three distinct neighborhoods: The Heathers, The Meadows, and The Summit. Rising above the Pacific Ocean and continuing upward on Kohala Ranch Road towards rolling green hills and meadows, the elevation within the community ranges from 120-feet above sea level to over 3,000 feet above sea level. WE ARE LOCATED CLOSEST TO THE OCEAN, IN THE HEATHERS.

name: Waikiki Studio With Kitchenette Rm 502
neighborhood_overview:
Waikiki Beach is arguably the most renowned beach in the entire world. Even local Hawaiians venture out to enjoy Waikiki's beauty and mingle with the tourists.
Famous for its picturesque white sand beach, there is plenty of swimming, sunbathing and water activities to be had. Beginning surf lessons are easy (yes, you can probably surf on your first lesson!) There's also boogie boarding and paddle boarding close by. For the milder experience, large sections of the beach are protected by seawalls and make the water calm and safe for anyone young and old!

Easy Access to All Things Waikiki :
Starbucks two blocks away
Cheesecake Factory six blocks away (always busy)
PF Changs nine blocks away
Honolulu Zoo across the street
Honolulu Aquarium three blocks away
Diamond Head Crater Park twelve blocks away (cab or bus recommended)
Waikiki Shell three blocks away (special concerts and events)

Tour Buses; pickup one block away
Pea

name: Hilton Ka'anapali Beach Club Ocean View
neighborhood_overview: Western Maui just 10 minutes from downtown Lahaina.  Shopping is across the street.  Restaurants are within walking distance and at the resort.  You never need to leave or use this as your home base for going snorkeling, whale watching, driving the road to Hana, visiting the volcano, ziplining, surfing, and more.
host_about: I am a small business owner.  The houses I list on airbnb are either on a 20 acre farm that I use for events, and to grow food and flowers or are within a timeshare that I own.  Timeshares are available most any time, and the houses on the farm are typically available from Sunday to Thursday, March to November and most anytime from mid-November to mid-March.   The farm is a farm, with gravel roads, some hills, etc.  The timeshares are high end options, exquisitely kept up, and offered a well below market value.  We take pride in offering high quality and reasonable accommodations with friendly service on our part.

name: Cozy Modern Waikiki
neighborhood_overview: 5 min walk to Royal Hawaiian beach walk, and Waikiki beach, fort Derussy Park, ala wai canal exercise area, the lei of parks, and international market place. 30 minute walk to Hawaiian convention center, ala moana shopping center,  magic island, and Kewalos basin. 45 minute drive to Waimanalo beach and 1 hour drive to the north shore and Waimea falls
host_about:
Aloha!

We are a newlywed couple with a new little baby that is also happy to meet you.

Recently we bought and remodeled our condo to be cozy and modern, close to all the best of Waikiki. Happy to provide tips for adventure, dining, shopping, surfing, snorkeling or walking to some of the best beaches the world has to offer.

We travel and enjoy accommodating guests while helping them to get the most out of their Hawaiian vacation.

Hoping you will enjoy your stay. Please feel free to send us your questions or comments.

Mahalo,

E&J+B

name: The Honu Suite 1 bedroom 30 day rental
A haven of rest
neighborhood_overview:
We are close to the famous green sands beach, and south point, and not far from the black sands beach. Plus we have a great caving
Expedition that some of our guest have said it’s the best on the island. You have to make reservations for that. We have a great coffee shop called the coffee grind. There are several place to eat near by and bakery. We have two grocery stores, post office, gift shop, auto store and hard ware store Ace, all in our little part of the island. On Sat there is a farmers market and on Wednesday in a town about 10 miles away from us they have a very nice farmers market. Which makes for a nice drive and visit to the famous Punalu'u Bakery that makes all the wonderful sweet breads for the island. We are near a couple of parks that have several hiking trails which makes for a nice walk for those who enjoy the outside.
host_about: We love people, the country life and gardening. Tim loves fishing and making things with his hands.

name: 2 Bedroom Condo at Royal Sea Cliffs Resort in Kona
host_about: Hello! After many years of vacation club and property ownership, we have had the opportunity to appreciate how extremely convenient and comfortable these style stays can be for all types of travel. As our family has grown, we've found that we have more than we need and are able to utilize every year which lead us to start offering our properties at a great deal to others! With years of experience, our knowledge has allowed us to help others enjoy their vacations and make life long memories. We've been able to grow the services we offer into a business that now also manages multiple different owners with various types of ownerships!  We are happy to be in a place where we can help both owners and vacationers, so don't hesitate to ask for what you need - even if it is not directly listed! We can often book multiple units and/or offer nearby locations. Booking multiple condos at one of our resorts is one of our favorite ways to get family and friends together. Whether you are celebrating or simply spending time together with friends or family, book with us for your next vacation -  Traveling only expands one's horizons!

name: Lawaia Sea Lodge -  Downstairs - Hosted
host_about: We have properties on all the islands!

name: Kailua Beach-Private Garden Studio - 30 Days Min.
neighborhood_overview:
There are so many things to see and do in Kailua - truly something to suit every mood. With miles of beautiful white sand and turquoise water, the beaches at Kailua and Lanikai are voted the best in the world by many international travel sites.

We have great food! Buzz's on the beach is a must for fabulous food and cocktails. Kalapawai Market grills beach burgers outside on the weekends. There are so many great places to eat and your guestbook will guide you to find what you're hungry for.

Kailua Town is filled with cute shops. Stroll to Red Bamboo, Turquoise Beach boutique, Coco's Trading Post, Bookends bookstore, Whole Foods, Starbucks, Maui Brewing Company and so many more.

There are several grocery stores, drugstores, bike rentals and kayak rentals.

Hike to the famous Pillboxes overlooking Kailua Bay and Lanikai Beach. Discover an ancient Hawaiian Heiau. Walk across Kawainui Wetlands. Visit the Farmer's Markets on Thursda
host_about: I am a long-time Kailua resident and absolutely love living in Kailua.

name: 3 Bed / 3 Bathroom Renovated  Kona Townhome
neighborhood_overview: Just over 1 mile from the town of Kona, this home is conveniently located on Ali'i Drive.  You can walk to town for dinner or an afternoon at Honl's beach.  Its just a short drive to Magic Sands beach.  There is a convenience store and vegetable/fruit market within 5 minutes walk.

name: Aloha Surf Studio
neighborhood_overview: This is an upscale, quiet, and well kept residential neighborhood.

name: 2 Bedroom Presidential Condo at Royal Garden
host_about: I’m a man of faith, adventurous, and I enjoy helping people, especially in traveling so that they will have a great vacation experience.

name: Waikiki Grand hotel... cute studio close to beach
neighborhood_overview: The condo is across the street from the Honolulu zoo and next to beautiful Queen Kapiolani Hotel. You walk out the lobby and can enjoy walking one block to the beach. You can walk up and down the beachfront to swim, shop or eat. There are tennis courts and lots of picnic spaces.
host_about: I am a female veterinarian working in Honolulu, Hawaii.  I have lived on the island of Oahu for 12 years.

name: Renovated kitchen & Ocean Views
neighborhood_overview:
Peaceful and private home overlooking the ocean.

• 8 min drive to the Hawaiian Botanical Gardens
• 9 min to Onomea Bay Trail
• 13 min to Hilo
• 13 min to Akaka Falls State Park
• 50 min to Volcano National Park
• Easy access to Saddle road, which features the some of the best stargazing in the world (at Mauna Kea Visitor Center, which is right off Saddle
Rd)
host_about: Aloha, Kurtis here. Mahalo for checking out my listings. Please feel free to message me with any questions, I love to help. I am looking forward to welcoming you to one of these amazing properties here on the Big Island of Hawai'i.

name: Private resort/hotel space in Waikiki
host_about: Loves to travel

name: Paradise View, Spacious Home
neighborhood_overview: Princeville is a residential neighborhood on the North Shore of Kauai. Shopping, restaurants, all services you can think of within 1 minute by car. Amazing hidden beaches and hikes are nearby as well as world class surfing and golf.

name: Waikiki Le'a Le'a   -  GE/TA 203 430 0928 01
host_about: We have properties on all the islands!

name: Kahala Oceanside
neighborhood_overview: Get the best of both worlds during your Hawaiian vacation in Oahu. Travelers love Honolulu for its cosmopolitan restaurants and shopping - the best in the whole state - and the ability to venture to the coast for some surfing and water sports, or into the interior for some lush mountain hiking. A warm tropical climate year round, with average daily highs between 80 °F and 89 °F (26 °C and 32 °C).

name: Private Luxury Suite!
neighborhood_overview: There is no other neighborhood like this on the north shore. With just one block to the beach and 2 acre properties around the entire block, privacy and luxury are things we do best!
host_about:
Aloha! 
I’m a mom, super high energy gal, originally from Minnesota and have been living on the north shore of Oahu for 15 years! I’m also a yoga teacher that runs the local yoga coop, the PTA president at the local elementary school, lover of traveler, avid friend, and a lifelong seeker of purpose and fulfillment. 
(And that profile pic is in our yard!! My daughter, Leila, and myself ran through that rainbow! A dream come true!)

name: Gecko'z South Sea Bungalows
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to South Sea Bungalows:
South Sea Arts has grown beyond the gallery to provide Polynesian culture aficionados and collectors of Hawaiiana alike with an oasis to call home during their stay on the island of Oahu. That's right, as of 2019, South Sea Arts is proud to present South Sea Bungalows at Coconut Plantation in Ko Olina. South Sea Bungalows is a vacation rental that has been meticulously designed and artfully decorated to provide guests with an authentic Polynesian experience. The bungalow also serves as a part time escape for the Souriolle family who live close by locally. The area is lined with world famous retreats including the Four Seasons Resort, Ko Olina Golf Club, and most notably the majestic Disney Aulani property that fronts the saltwater kissed coastline. The shores of Ko Olina explain why people from all over the planet flock to this destination as a series of lagoons carve their mark and collect sea life in their sanctuary as the tide ebbs and flows. Nu
host_about: Hawaii artist that wanted to provide a home to our guest that didn't look like it could be anywhere in the world when you entered it... bring you back to a time of old Hawaii, that romantic, mysterious and exotic era of Nostalgic Waikiki.  A place to share new memories with your ohana, not just a leather chair to rest your head on, but that bamboo chair that makes you sigh and say "ahhhhh Hawaii"

name: Lawai Beach 1 BR Villa
neighborhood_overview: In Kauai, the adventurous can hike the spectacular four mile round-trip coastal trail to Mahaulepu Beach or learn about the South Shore's extensive history on the Koloa Heritage Trail. Explore remote, hidden areas by kayak, horseback, mountain bike, ATV or helicopter. Golfers have 36 holes of championship play and tennis is unlimited. Of course, you can also stay in town and explore the local shops and restaurants, soaking up the "aloha" spirit that makes Hawaii such a beloved destination!

name: Beachfront Waiohai Club Resort+Premium Amenities
neighborhood_overview: Experience the exquisite serenity and unparalleled natural beauty of the "Garden Isle" - the diverse terrain invites you to explore rugged cliffs, towering waterfalls and lush rainforest. The water invites even more opportunities for adventure - charter a catamaran ride along the island's Na Pali Coast during your stay, snorkel among vibrantly-hued aquatic life at Poipu Beach or catch a wave to feel the exhilaration of surfing firsthand. For a truly stunning view, stop by Kilauea Lighthouse.

neighborhood_overview: Located in the town of Lahaina and overlooks Maui's famed Ka'anapali Beach, where you can enjoy snorkeling, surfing or just kicking back relaxing on the pristine sands. It's also just blocks from Whaler Village for great dining and shopping. Looking for a truly unique experience? Visit in the winter to see whales taking refuge in the warmer, southern waters!

name: Aloha Sanctuary
neighborhood_overview: We are located in Hawaiian Paradise Park, a large subdivision on a rugged east-facing coastline. A 15-minute walk or bike ride takes you to where the ocean meets lava cliffs. We are a short distance from fabulous outdoor markets:  Maku'u Market on Sundays 8am-2pm, or Kalapana on Saturdays from 8am-noon. Hilo has a market everyday downtown from 7am-3pm, with expanded vendors on Wednesdays and Saturdays. Volcanoes National Park is about an hour drive, and a must-see!  A 45 minute drive brings you to the most recent lava flow, and beautiful black sand beach of Pohoiki. The quaint town of Pahoa, 20 minutes away, offers great restaurants (try Pele's Kitchen for breakfast, Ning's or Kaleo's or Pahoa Fresh Fish for dinner), a few colorful boutiques, and Island Naturals or Malama Market for groceries. The town of Kea'au is 15 minutes away with grocery, drug, and hardware stores. The small town of Orchidland hosts a new more casual version of Kaleo's restaurant, open daily 8am-8pm. Hilo is a 25
host_about: My husband Steve and I have been coming to the Big Island since 2004.  We love the Aloha spirit, the beauty of the land, water, people, flora, fauna...we love most everything about the Big Island.  We strive to be good neighbors and contribute to any community we spend time in.

name: Beach Theme Home w/ Mercedes SUV
neighborhood_overview: Minutes away from multiple golf courses, restaurants for dining, and beaches.
host_about:
Both me and my wife are retired from the U.S. Army. I am currently a full time graduate student and enjoy spending free time with our lovely daughter, biking, swimming, golfing, and hiking. 
As career healthcare professionals, both me and my wife are likewise fond of the diversified professionals, business entrepreneurs, executives, and the many others alike that reside in our forever Hawaii home.
When you stay with us, we consider you part of our Ohana (family). We cherish and dignify getting to know people like yourselves and your pursuit of Aloha!

name: Beachfront Ka'anapali Ocean Studio+AmenitiesTennis
neighborhood_overview:
These modern villas located on the other side of Black Rock from Whaler’s Village. It is conveniently located mere minutes from Lahaina to the south and Kapalua to the north.

offers an abundance of on-site amenities and services. The Spa Heilani Heavenly Spa is combines an East meets West aesthetic with local Hawaiian influences. 13 total treatment rooms are available and in-villa services are also provided. A special “tree house” villa is available for couples who wish to enjoy their massage or treatment while taking in the fresh Hawaiian air and the soothing sounds of the Pacific. The spa is located in the Ocean Resort Villas North Tower phase directly next door to the South phase.

The WORKOUT Fitness Studios are open 24/7 and they feature high quality state-of-the-art fitness equipment. The Villas North and South each have their own fitness center and guests at the resort are welcome to use either fitness center.

name: BEACHFRONT.Ka'anapali Ocean Resort+Amenities, 2BR
neighborhood_overview:
These modern villas located on the other side of Black Rock from Whaler’s Village. It is conveniently located mere minutes from Lahaina to the south and Kapalua to the north.

offers an abundance of on-site amenities and services. The Spa Heilani Heavenly Spa is combines an East meets West aesthetic with local Hawaiian influences. 13 total treatment rooms are available and in-villa services are also provided. A special “tree house” villa is available for couples who wish to enjoy their massage or treatment while taking in the fresh Hawaiian air and the soothing sounds of the Pacific. The spa is located in the Ocean Resort Villas North Tower phase directly next door to the South phase.

The WORKOUT Fitness Studios are open 24/7 and they feature high quality state-of-the-art fitness equipment. The Villas North and South each have their own fitness center and guests at the resort are welcome to use either fitness center.

name: Moonflower Model #2 overlooking the pool
neighborhood_overview:
All of our units require us to block out a full month for each reservation -
So we approve or decline based on the total revenue the owner will receive , determined by the number of guests and number of days reserved -
Typically we are looking to net at least half of a normal monthly rate -
Smaller units rent for less than larger and some complexes are less than others.

name: Piece of Paradise
neighborhood_overview: Walking distance to beach, park, supermarket, bus, Ala Moana more, restaurants, Waikiki strip, convention center.

name: Luxurious Lanai Studio Suite in Waikiki
host_about: Married with 4 kids, all now gainfully employed!

name: Beautiful Private Basement Unit with AC
neighborhood_overview: This suite is close to some of the best places to eat, surf and swim on the North Shore. We are excited to open our family vacation home to you so your group can make magical memories here in beautiful Hawaii! This 1 bedroom suite is attached to the main house but totally separate. Ground level, ocean view with AC and it sleeps 4! Please do not smoke inside or party loudly, as there are neighbours on either side.
host_about: TRUST THAT GOD WILL WORK HIS WILL... IN HIS TIMING!

name: Paradise Above the Crowds
neighborhood_overview:
We are in a rural neighborhood in the heart of Kona coffee country with lots of coffee farms and greenery. The village of Holualoa, a small artists community with a number of galleries, a coffee shop, a small convenience store and a post office, is about two and a half miles north.

On the first Friday of every month, the Village of Holualoa holds "First Friday After Dard" a "celebration of art, music, food and culture." this is a good place to go, see the local people, sample the local cuisine and listen to music.

Also in the area we have the Hula Daddy store and plantation, the UCC coffee store and plantation, and a few other coffee farms.
host_about: Aloha. Mieko and Dan just started hosting in our beautiful Holualoa house. Our purpose is to help visitors to our magical island have the best time possible while here.

name: Studio Steps from the Bike Path near Sunset Beach
neighborhood_overview: A short walk and even shorter bike ride from Ted's Bakery, Vland, and Sunset Beach, the North Shore is often referred to as the "7 mile miracle". The winter brings awe inspiring surf and the summer provides picturesque tropical beaches and snorkeling.  A short 5 minute drive to Turtle Bay and 10 miles to Haleiwa and Laie respectively. Easy access to Waimea Bay and Valley, Pipeline, Turtle Bay and the Polynesian Cultural Center.
host_about:
We are a little family of 4 living on the north shore of Oahu. 

We love the simple life; bike rides, surfing, swimming, playing in the sand, gardening, and working on our house.

name: Attached Private Ocean View Cottage
neighborhood_overview: Our featured rentals are located approximately 8 miles North of exciting Downtown Lahaina, between Kaanapali and Kapalua in the Kahana/Napili area. Our Private Maui Beach Estate is right across the road from the Pacific Ocean, literally steps away.We are less than a five minute drive from the world famous Kapalua Golf Courses, Kaanapali Golf Courses, and Kapalua Tennis Garden.We are conveniently located within one mile of nearby shops, restaurants, grocery stores, and many award-winning beaches.

name: Home of Aloha, 5 Bedrooms / 4 Bath, Sleeps 14
neighborhood_overview:
Closest beach is a 5 minute walk, restaurants, supermarkets and stores are less than 10 minutes drive away. Close to scenic lookouts, water sports and the famous Hanauma Bay where you can snorkel and swim with fishes.
Attractions near by:
Waikiki, Haunauma Bay, Makapuu light house, Blow Hole, Koko Head Trail, China Walls
Waimanalo Bay, water sports (Jet Skiing, Banana Boat rides, Bumper tube rides, Scuba Dive, Stand up Surfing, Paddle Boarding, Parasail, Wake Boarding, Water Skiing, Underwater Scooters, etc)
host_about: Property Manager

name: Stunning N Shore estate, ocean & mountain views
neighborhood_overview:
The home is in a gated subdivision for safety and privacy. Less than a 5 minute walk across the street to the beach or neighboring fruit stands. 5 minute drive to Turtle Bay Resort, Kawela Bay, and Sunset Beach. Shopping and dining in charming Haleiwa town just a 15 minute drive away.

Horseback riding, snorkeling, hiking, surfing, golfing, eco tours and fishing are just some of the activities offered nearby. If you don't want to drive anywhere, you can WALK to the beach, collect shells, grab some fresh pineapple from the fruit stand below the property and head back sit in the hot tub and relax and enjoy the views!

name: The Mango Tree Cottage
neighborhood_overview: This is a very special neighborhood with one grocery store and several food trucks. Pupukea Grill and the Sunrise Shack being two of our favorites!

name: Country Road, Take Me Home
neighborhood_overview:
The vacation home is located in Kaneohe, Hawaii, United States. Tucked away from the hustle-and-bustle of Honolulu/Waikiki....but a close commute to everything! Whether it's swimming, snorkeling, beachcombing, horseback riding, ATV riding, hiking, exploring every nook and cranny of the island, taking in unparalleled beauty, sampling from O'ahu's diverse and delicious cuisine, you are in a convenient location from which to launch the day's activities. Just one mile up the road, the picturesque 153-acre Kualoa Regional Beach Park offers sweeping mountain and ocean views, picnic lawns, and beach access, while Kualoa Ranch & Zipline, a 4,000-acre private nature reserve and working cattle ranch, offers a plethora of activities: horseback riding, ATV riding, zip-lining, and tours of Hollywood film locations.
For a literal and delicious taste of Aloha, you'll want to visit
Tropical Farms Macadamia Nut Farm, just up the road from the vacation home, which began years ago as a simpl
host_about:
Born and raised in western Massachusetts, about as far away as one can possibly be from Hawai'i and still be in the United States, I arrived on O'ahu for a one-month vacation in 1980…but Hawai'i is hard to get out of one's system and I stayed to make Hawai'i my new home state. I’ve been exploring and loving the islands, people, and culture of Hawai'i for nearly four decades. I bought my first property on O'ahu in 1983, and during the 45-day escrow period, I earned my State of Hawai'i real estate license. Just two years later, I purchased the company I’d been working for; upon selling that business in 1986, I began and built my company, Fidelity Properties, from the ground up.  I purchased this beautiful (undeveloped) property in 1989 and built my home and the rental home and, over the years, I've nurtured the 'aina (land).  I enjoy swimming,  boating, and staying active.  Most importantly,  I am happy to share this paradise with you. 

Why this property?  "Keep the COUNTRY country."  You will see intermittent signs along the road on your way to the home.  The village of Waikane is in "the country"  away from the developed and more congested and populated areas of the island, and residents would like to keep it that way!  Here, there are flower farms and  and fruit trees.....a little bit of yesteryear and a country road that hugs the shoreline and takes you along an incredibly scenic drive along the windward coastline and onto the North Shore.  The quiet, windward side of O'ahu, from Kahuku to Kaneohe, is renowned for its lush vegetation, breezy trade winds, spectacular beaches, friendly little towns, and laid-back lifestyle.  With just about everything close at hand and several convenient avenues to Honolulu as well as the North Shore, it is no wonder I fell in love with and chose windward O'ahu, backdropped by the dramatic Ko'olau Mountain range, for my home and business base.  The nearest town is Kane'ohe, only a 15-minute drive, where you will find a variety of restaurants and shopping, a newly-expanded mall, movie theaters, and grocery stores.  

An acre of oceanfront, prettily landscaped with palm trees, flowers, and a lily pond, offers tranquility at the water's edge (the 'ae kai).....Sit and relax:  your view is the Chinaman's Hat sitting in the calm bay and the Ko'olau's rising steeply.  Forget your cares, feel anxiety slip away, savor the serenity.....

name: Walk to Beach/ 30 day minimum  Large Studio
neighborhood_overview: 1 Block to Beach Studio. **INQUIRE for available dates!!**Spacious, very comfortable great safe neighborhood. It has a queen bed, Hotel style kitchen with toaster/convection oven, microwave, coffee maker, mini fridge, and outdoor shower. There is a  private entrance,  & free off street parking, and a shared wash machine.  It is a very comfortable, clean, affordable place to stay in most desirable location.
host_about: I love living a block from one of the most beautiful beaches in the world. I love to bike ride, hang out with my daughters and my friends.  I like to hike and see the many breathtaking views that this area has to offer. I love to read, if I have time.

name: Beachfront 3-Bedroom Penthouse Grand Waikikian
neighborhood_overview:
Fantastic restaurants, shops and, of course, the beach are right on our doorstep. We're just ten minutes from downtown Honolulu and 20 minutes from Honolulu International Airport. Visiting Waikiki for a conference or event? The Hawaii Convention Center is only a ten-minute walk away

20 minutes from Honolulu International Airport (HNL)

Explore these Waikiki attractions near The Grand Islander:

• Ala Moana Beach Park
• Waikiki Aquarium
• Diamond Head Crater
• Honolulu Zoo
• USS Arizona Memorial

name: Renovated One Bedroom Cottage with Yard by Waikiki
neighborhood_overview: Kaimuki is one of the most sought-after neighborhoods in Honolulu. It is quiet and family-oriented, yet is a 10 minute walk to the excitement of Waikiki or the beauty of Queens Beach. Kaimuki boasts a handful of cute shops and great restaurants, just 3 blocks from the unit. Some of our local favorites are Diamond Head Market & Grill, Bogarts, South Shore Grill, Diamond Head Cove Health Bar, Surf n Turf Tacos, Pioneer Saloon. Open Space Yoga, a great little studio, is just up the road as well.
host_about: Teacher in Honolulu, Hawaii

name: Feel the Spirit of Aloha at the Royal Sea Cliff
neighborhood_overview: 5 minute walk to downtown Kailua-Kona and a short drive to all the restaurants, Costco, and Walmart.
host_about: Avid world traveler who o has been to Hawaii over 30+ times.

name: Stunning Luxury Family Estate in Kona
neighborhood_overview: Quiet and safe gated community with wonderful sunset ocean views! Close to shopping, dinning, and beaches.

name: Izetta-4 bedroom apartment-Downtown Hilo
neighborhood_overview:
Historic Downtown Hilo is just about a mile long with 2 main streets this unit is at one end of the town. The farmers market is right behind the building, lots of shops, restaurants, galleries and cafes, (no need for a car)...but if you plan to see the island and all of its magical beauty, you will need a car.
Just a few things that I want to share before I accept your booking….
We only have street parking, which usually is no problem.
The laundry is the laundromat across the street. Note: best laundromat ever, lol.
This apartment is in downtown Hilo, with some downtown life.
The property is gated with a coded entry gate. There are 4 more units on the property and censored security lights around the whole building, and a property manager who lives on site.
We are in tropical Hawaii, it is not uncommon everywhere in Hawaii to find insects, here at Izetta we take precautions to keep that from happening, although sometimes they just show up.... like the tu
host_about:
Hi, I'm Marlene. 
The big island has so much to offer, and I am happy to be able to provide you a place to stay while you experience Hawaii.
Thank you for choosing our place.

name: Aloha Puna!
neighborhood_overview: Leilani Estates is a private, proud, and tight-knit community.  Well regulated with Community Watch volunteers who patrol the streets daily.  Please respect our neighbors and all community signs with aloha.

name: Ewa Beach Ohana Special
neighborhood_overview: Quiet, peaceful neigborhood 5 minute drive from beach with loads of shopping and dining within 10 minute drive.
host_about: Quiet

name: Central Island Charm
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood has many food options from sit down to take out options  less than 1/2 mile from condo. This also includes a grocery store and Walmart.
host_about: Young professional, loves to travel and explore!

name: Secluded Off Grid Coffee Farm
neighborhood_overview: I am 1 mile from the General store and gas station. The main road to the rest of the Island is there too! It is a quiet neighborhood that is 20 minutes from downtown, and 25 minutes to Kahena beach. I am fortunate to have only one close neighbor next to me. Across the street and down a little ways are 3 horses.

name: Kaneohe Bay Hideaway
neighborhood_overview: The beautiful Kaneohe Bay is a hidden gem, that has so many magnificent places to experience within it. There's Chinaman's Hat which is a small island shaped like a China man's hat, (hence the name) with a hike to the top (advise: experienced hikers), and a small beach I call Pirates Pit. The island is only accessible by boat, kayak, or  paddle board. There's a private beach located at the base of the Kualoa mountains called Secret Island. And we can't forget the famous Kaneohe Bay SandBar. It is best described as a beach in the middle of the bay which is only accessible by boat, kayak, or paddle board. The small quiet town of Kaneohe is 5 minutes away with great restaurants and food options, grocery store, Starbucks and shopping mall.

name: 花香る癒しのゲストルーム
neighborhood_overview:
There is a Food Mart ”Matsuyama Food Mart” just a minute's drive away where you can buy food, drinks and hot deli items. 15 minutes to Kona Town, 5 minutes to Makalei Golf Course, 15 minutes to nearby beaches.
Waimea Town 45 minutes, Hilo 100 minutes. And it is easy to get to everywhere you want to go.
host_about:
東京生まれの東京育ち｡39歳の時にハワイ島に移住してきました。ハワイ島は自然豊かでたくさんのたのしみがあります。ここに住む人々もとてもフレンドリーで親切です。ここでの生活は最高です。ハワイ島の素晴らしさをここを訪問する人々にも体験してほしいと思い、宿を始めました。この島の雄大さやたくさんの魅力を知っていただければと思います｡
また、小さなコーヒー農園でもあるので焙煎したてのコーヒーを飲んでいただいたり、季節のフルーツを食べていただいたりできるのもおすすめです。
主人のYoshiと高校生の息子Takumiの3人でみなさまをお迎えいたします。主人はツアーガイドをしているので、観光のアドバイスもできます。

name: Beautiful Beach Cottage: lush garden paradise
neighborhood_overview:
Kihei is known as the sunniest part of the island of Maui. It might be raining or cloudy in Lahaina, Kahului or Paia, but sunny and warm in Kihei! Kihei feels like a surf town, with a low key vibe and lots of beautiful beaches, all with public access. We also enjoy lots of restaurants, shops and local activities here (just ask us some fun things to do!). If you want a 'resort-type' evening or outing, it's only a 10 minute drive to Wailea, with its hotels, restaurants, golf courses and shopping. There's so much to do on Maui, or you can do nothing at all but relax on any of the gorgeous nearby beaches.
Our location is incredibly private, but also central and within easy walking distance to restaurants, public tennis courts, surfing lessons, beautiful public beaches and snorkeling spots, basketball courts, movie theaters, a farmers' market and supermarkets. Within a few minutes' drive you can also find numerous golf courses, scenic hikes, shopping and world-class kite and wind surfi

name: Aloha Hale - Hilo/Pahoa
neighborhood_overview: Hawaiian Paradise Park is quite unique and beautiful.  Located between Hilo and Pahoa, just down from Volcano Village and Volcano Natl Park.  There are easy to moderate hikes, in the Park,  along the ocean  where you may see dolphin & turtles and you will see whales in the winter as they give birth right off the coast, or hike through the jungle.  Although Hilo is very rainy you'll find my home in lower Paradise Park have much more sun. Pahoa is an artist hang out with museams, musicians and great healthy food.  There is even a warm pond for swimming just beyond the new lava flow.  The outdoor markets are the best on the islands, offering local food, fruits & vegies, unique items, music and more.

name: Hale Mahina Beach House
neighborhood_overview:
"Hale Mahina" means House of the Moon.
When you are winding down from an amazing day on the white sand beach, the moon will appear to rise out of the tropical blue water. You can relax on the large front porch. The imagery may make you wonder if this place is real.
This is a newly remodeled 3 bedroom 2 bath home with hardwood floors and a true Hawaiian country Feel to it. It boasts a full Kitchen with all the comforts of home, it has a Large covered front deck where you can relax and recharge. If you are looking for the opposite of a downtown Honolulu city vibe this is your place. Located at the north end of Punuluu Beach Park this beach is considered "crowded" if there are more than 2 people on it. (not because it is tiny, but because people are limited) At night there will be a few fishermen at most. name: Shores Waikoloa - Remodeled 1 Bedroom Condo
neighborhood_overview:
Waikoloa Resort is a very walkable area and Our great central location within the Resort allows you the opportunity to easily explore many of it’s attractions such as as the Petroglyphs, shopping at Queens and King Shop, diverse dining options, luaus and the famous Anaeho'omalu Bay. We are located in between 2 renowned golf courses: Beach and King’s Course.

Anaeho'omalu Bay or A-Bay is a beautiful white sand beach that attracts many tourists daily. A-Bay is famous for its tranquil waters and multiple water activities options such as: swimming, snorkeling, stand up paddle, canoe paddling, sailing, windsurfing, boat tours such as glass-bottom boat, dive boats, whale watch tours. When hanging out at A-Bay you most likely will encounter a Honu (Hawaiian Green Sea Turtle) either swimming or taking a nap.

Perfectly located between Honolulu/Waikiki and North Shore about a 35 drive min each. Schofeild Barracks and Wheeler Air Feild only 10 min away.

name: Exclusive Paniolo Suite, Newly Remodeled 1 Bdrm
neighborhood_overview:
Waimea-Kamuela’s Hawaiian cowboy roots make this a unique destination for your vacation in Hawaii. Located near historic Parker Ranch, one of the largest ranches in the United States, and within walking distance to Waimea town, Waimea Country Lodge is truly special.

Enjoy fantastic weather at Waimea’s 2,500 ft. elevation, just inland from the majestic Kohala Coast. Everywhere you look are green rolling hills, pastures, and stunning views of Mauna Kea. Sip complimentary locally grown coffee at the hotel in the misty mornings. Stroll through Waimea Town’s antique stores and coffee shops in the afternoon. Dine at on-site Paniolo Country Inn restaurant or the many great eateries around town including: Merriman’s, Red Water Café, or check out the Big Island Brewhaus for live music and tasty beer flights.

- Enjoy locally sourced produce, foods, and crafts at Waimea
Town Farmers Market next door on Saturdays.

- Drive 15 minutes to Hapuna Beach, the

name: 1 Bed/1 Bath Partial Ocean View w/ AC & Wifi
neighborhood_overview:
Explore the historic seaside town of Kailua-Kona!

A five-minute drive finds you in the heart of historic Kailua-Kona Town with its casual boutiques, restaurants, and cultural sites that include Ahuena Heiau and Hulihee Palace. Hop aboard a sportfishing charter at Kailua Pier or kayak in waters fronting Alii Drive.

Endless adventures in all directions!

Hit the road to explore quaint villages with mom-and-pop shops strung along the Kona Coast. Hawaii Island’s most popular West Shore activities include sipping your way through Kona Coffee Country, exploring the sacred Puuhonua o Honaunau National Historic Park, snorkeling at Kahaluu Beach, and night diving amid manta rays in Keauhou Bay.

- Shop at Keauhou Shopping Center
- Dine oceanfront along Alii Drive
- Stroll historic Kailua-Kona town
- Swim and snorkel at the best beaches
- Visit Hawaii’s top cultural and historical sites
- Explore Kona Coffee Country

name: Marriott Ko Olina Studio - King Bed & sofa sleeper
Oceanfront New House on Kealakekua Bay
neighborhood_overview:
Kealekekua bay is the jewel of the Kona coast. For hundreds of years it has served as an idyllic sanctuary for marine life, sea birds, and people as well. Swim out from the backyard and instantly see hundreds of reef fish plus green sea turtles, eagle rays, humpback whales and dolphins. As a Marine Life Conservation District, the ecosystem is nearly pristine. The bay is the ultimate swimmer’s paradise - clear, calm, and full of marine life. Ka‘awaloa Cove (near Cook Monument) is a 15 minute kayak or Standup Paddle board away from the house and has some of the best coral reef in all of Hawaii.

The house is 15 minutes to Choice Mart and KTA in Captain Cook. There are many restaurants and services up the hill as well.

name: Award Winning Bamboo Room: Ala Kai Bed & Breakfast
neighborhood_overview:
We are located on Hawaii Island's Eastern Puna District, on gorgeous Kaloli Point on Paradise Ala Kai Drive. Some would argue we have the best weather on the island. Kaloli Point is called the Blue Hole because it is often sunny here while other areas in East Hawaii are raining. Our windward trade winds keep us five to eight degrees cooler than Kona. Rarely do we have vog (volcano fog).

Ala Kai Bed and Breakfast is in one of the best neighborhoods in East Hawaii and right across the street from the water.

Kaloli Point has a stunning trail that starts a few houses away. Suzy and I often walk out on the point to look down at 25 foot cliffs and watch often large surf break. We have a lot of large green sea turtles here and whale watching season is November to April. The neighborhood has a whale watch and we all text each other to alert each other of whales.

Many of our guests take a morning stroll down Paradise Ala Kai Drive past large water front home
host_about: Suzy and I are both retired professionals. Suzy is a retired teachers aid who is wonderful with kids and people. Erich is a retired real estate professional. We are passionate about creating the best bed and breakfast on Hawaii Island! Rated 5 stars on Trip Advisor! Come stay with us and experience professionalism.

Kaloli Point is called the Blue Hole because it is often sunny here while other areas in East Hawaii are raining. Our windward trade winds keep us five to eight degrees cooler than Kona. Rarely do we have vog (volcano fog).

Ala Kai Bed and Breakfast is in one of the best neighborhoods in East Hawaii and right across the street from the water.

Kaloli Point has a stunning trail that starts a few houses away. Suzy and I often walk out on the point to look down at 25 foot cliffs and watch often large surf break. We have a lot of large green sea turtles here and whale watching season is November to April. The neighborhood has a whale watch and we all text each other to alert each other of whales.

Many of our guests take a morning stroll down Paradise Ala Kai Drive past large water front home

name: Writers Studio at Dragonfly Ranch

host_about:
Barbara has studied with a number of respected kahunas who taught her Hawaiian Lomilomi (a sacred rejuvenation treatment), Ho’oponopono (a method of "setting things right") and Hawaiian healing herbs. 

With the help of quality assistance from her Ohana (adopted family), five dogs and two cats, Barbara hosts fun loving travelers looking for an authentic Hawaiian experience, enjoying healthy pleasures. 

Besides loving her life at the Dragonfly, Barbara’s present personal passion is to finish her screenplay called, “To Die Laughing”.

name: Award Winning Jungle Aloha Suite: Ala Kai B&B
neighborhood_overview:
We are located on Hawaii Island's Eastern Puna District, on gorgeous Kaloli Point on Paradise Ala Kai Drive. Some would argue we have the best weather on the island. Kaloli Point is called the Blue Hole because it is often sunny here while other areas in East Hawaii are raining. Our windward trade winds keep us five to eight degrees cooler than Kona. Rarely do we have vog (volcano fog).

Ala Kai Bed and Breakfast is in one of the best neighborhoods in East Hawaii and right across the street from the water.

Kaloli Point has a stunning trail that starts a few houses away. Suzy and I often walk out on the point to look down at 25 foot cliffs and watch often large surf break. We have a lot of large green sea turtles here and whale watching season is November to April. The neighborhood has a whale watch and we all text each other to alert each other of whales.

Many of our guests take a morning stroll down Paradise Ala Kai Drive past large water front home

host_about: Hello! After many years of vacation club and property ownership, we have had the opportunity to appreciate how extremely convenient and comfortable these style stays can be for all types of travel. name: My place is close to the Beach
Kaneohe Bay Adventure(Discounted Rate Sept)
neighborhood_overview: The beautiful Kaneohe Bay is a hidden gem, that has so many magnificent places to experience within it. There's Chinaman's Hat which is a small island shaped like a China man's hat, (hence the name) with a hike to the top (advise: experienced hikers), and a small beach I call Pirates Pit. The island is only accessible by boat, kayak, or  paddle board. There's a private beach located at the base of the Kualoa mountains called Secret Island. And we can't forget the famous Kaneohe Bay SandBar. It is best described as a beach in the middle of the bay which is only accessible by boat, kayak, or paddle board. The small quiet town of Kaneohe is 5 minutes away with great restaurants and food options, grocery store, Starbucks and shopping mall.

neighborhood_overview: Nearby are manificient public beaches of Keawakapu, Kamaole and Wailea. Along the coast treat yourself to the ultimate in deep-sea fishing, diving, snorkeling, surfing and ocean swimming. Take your golf game to the world-famous Wailea Country Club and its 36-holes of lush fairways and emerald greens, just one mile from the resort. A sightseeing-must is a visit to the adventures of Kaleakala National Park for more than 30 miles of fantastic hiking and hoseback riding.
host_about:
Like you, I love to travel, including cruising. I love to help people. I love to be hospitable. I love to read, especially about the places I am about to visit in my travels and adventures.  My husband and I have visited most of the European countries, north and south, as well as: Turkey, Israel, Greece. Southeast Asia, and the Western Rockies of the United States and Western Canada. We have also visited the western shores of South America.

"What you know is a function of whom you choose to believe." This is my husband's (Ph.D.) saying. Of course, I believe it.

I just retired after thirty (30) years with one company. Now, I am enjoying sharing our  luxurious vacation resort (which has properties around the world and within the USA). Name any place on this globe, and I will try to help you make your dream vacation or travel experience come true. 

I am looking forward to hearing from you.

Thank you,

Lorie

Hawaii County Restrictions:

- Quiet hours shall be from 9:00pm to 8:00am, during which time the noise from the rental shall not unreasonably disturb adjacent neighbors

- Sound that is audible beyond the property boundaries during non-quiet hours shall not be more excessive than would be otherwise associated with a residential area

- Guest vehicles shall be parked in the designated onsite parking area

name: Makaha Oceanfront Condo with Pool & Free Parking
neighborhood_overview: A little history of the Mākaha area: Hawaiʻi’s first premier big wave surf spot wasn’t always Waimea on Oʻahu or Peʻahi (aka Jaws) on Maui. It was a break located on the west side of Oʻahu, just up the coast from Waiʻanae, called Mākaha. In ʻōlelo Hawaiʻi (Hawaiian language), Mākaha means “fierce, savage or ferocious.” Nothing placed Mākaha’s into surfing history more than the Mākaha International Surfing Championships (1953—1973). Put on by The Waiʻanae Lions Club and Waikīkī Surf Club, the event was the first international surf contest held in Hawaiʻi and, in 1962, it was the first televised surf contest ever, running on ABC’s “Wide World of Sports.” Nowadays, the break is a proving ground for big wave surfers, and on smaller days, works as a fun surf spot for new and intermediate surfers.

Conveniently located restaurants include Jackie Rey's Ohana Grill, Green Flash Co
host_about: I have access to 200+ resorts throughout the country that offer a much better vacation experience when compared to a hotel room. These are primarily Club Wyndham. Our resorts allow our renters access to amenities and privileges that are normally reserved for owners. Enjoy full kitchens that come with all the basic supplies you need to cook for yourself or friends and family, in-suite washer and dryer, 24-hour security, maintenance staff and front desk personnel and a concierge to help you make the most of your stay

name: Apt L- 2 bedroom apartment, Downtown Hilo
neighborhood_overview:
Historic Downtown Hilo is just about a mile long with 2 main streets this unit is at one end of the town. The farmers market is right behind the building, lots of shops, restaurants, galleries, and cafes, (no need for a car)...but if you plan to see the island and all of its magical beauty, you will need a car.
Just a few things that I want to share before I accept your booking….
We only have street parking, which usually is no problem.
The laundry is the laundromat across the street. Note: best laundromat ever, lol.
This apartment is in downtown Hilo, with some downtown life.
The property is gated with a coded entry gate. There are 4 more units on the property and censored security lights around the whole building, and a property manager who lives on site.
We are in tropical Hawaii, it is not uncommon everywhere in Hawaii to find insects, here at 98 Ponahawai St. we take precautions to keep that from happening, although sometimes they just show up....
host_about:
Hi, I'm Marlene. 
The big island has so much to offer, and I am happy to be able to provide you a place to stay while you experience Hawaii.
Thank you for choosing our place.

name: Kauai Coast Resort at Beachboy: Studio
host_about:
Hello, my future guests. I am Mariyam often goes by Mia. I am glad to be part of the Airbnb hosting community. I believe that hosting people especially when they are traveling with their loved ones on a vacation or to meet their loved ones or just by themselves if I can add a bit of joy and comfort to their experience, will give me immense satisfaction. 

I am an avid traveler myself, and every time I travel I learn from my own personal experience. Being away from home, sometimes you want to feel you are at home. I hope to offer the same sense of comfort to my guests. 

I look forward to hosting you and learning a little bit about you.

name: Ohana at the Dutch Farm House w/ shared pool
neighborhood_overview:
The town of pahoa is 19 miles from ITO, (Hilo airport) very eclectic and 2 miles away with every amenity you may need. Grocery stores, laundry, restaurants, coffee shops, a community pool, farmers markets, boutiques, music venues and more!

Red road (puna costal highway) is a short 10 minute drive
host_about:
Aloha! Very excited to be hosting and engaging in my true passion; which is hospitality, creating comfortable and beautiful spaces, and sharing my property with amazing travelers from around the world! 

I’ve made incredible new friends in the short time I’ve been hosting and can’t wait to meet you as well! 

Please note that we have a 10 month old standard poodle pup and jungle kitten goddess on property who are very social and love interacting with our guests as well!

host_about:
We are Trisha and Sterling who live on the Big Island of Hawaii. We grow coffee, pineapple, guava, bananas, papaya, oranges, lemons, limes and all types of greens and herbs..  We have 4 cats and a dog, Mama.  
We have been married for 30 yrs. and travel the world together.  Our passion is travel and  dancing Salsa and other Latin Dances plus Ballroom.  We love our life here and enjoy sharing this Paradise of Hawaii.

name: Makai Club Cottages - 2 Bedroom
host_about: Hello, I'm Ani, a globetrotter from Virginia who spent my childhood exploring the world. Growing up amidst diverse cultures sparked my love for travel and resorts. Now, as an Airbnb host, I share that passion with my guests. Each space I curate is a blend of my global experiences, ensuring a stay that transcends the ordinary. Join me on a journey where every corner tells a story. Welcome to my world of wanderlust!

name: Tropical Fun- Royal Garden @ Waikiki- Studio Condo
Westin Ka'anapali Luxury 1 BR Villa w Full Kitchen
neighborhood_overview: Maui's gentle climate and fabled surroundings are ideal for your relaxing, yet invigorating vacation experience. Nestled between the shimmering Pacific Ocean and West Maui Mountains, this resort is your pristine surfside retreat on Maui's beautiful North Kā‘anapali Beach.

name: Full 2 Bedroom Condo - Wyndham's Mauna Loa Village
host_about: Hello! After many years of vacation club and property ownership, we have had the opportunity to appreciate how extremely convenient and comfortable these style stays can be for all types of travel. As our family has grown, we've found that we have more than we need and are able to utilize every year which lead us to start offering our properties at a great deal to others! With years of experience, our knowledge has allowed us to help others enjoy their vacations and make life long memories. We've been able to grow the services we offer into a business that now also manages multiple different owners with various types of ownerships!  We are happy to be in a place where we can help both owners and vacationers, so don't hesitate to ask for what you need - even if it is not directly listed! We can often book multiple units and/or offer nearby locations. Booking multiple condos at one of our resorts is one of our favorite ways to get family and friends together. Whether you are celebrating or simply spending time together with friends or family, book with us for your next vacation -  Traveling only expands one's horizons!

name: Aina Haina. Honolulu Hideaway
neighborhood_overview: This valley property is between Diamond Head and Hawaii Kai.  From the airport it's about 10 miles and about 15 minutes drive on average.  The Valley is called Aina Haina and has a popular local shopping center with a local Market, Gas Station, McDonalds, MassageEnvy, Post Office, and Beaches across the street with great uncrowded surf spots.  A 5-10 minute drive will put you at Diamond Head/Waikiki in one direction from the rental and if you go the other other direction you'll be at Hawaii Kai, Costco or Hanauma Bay in the same time period, a favorite place for visitors, here's a TIP, go early for good beach parking. Closed Mondays.
host_about: I have not only been raised in Kailua, Oahu in Hawaii but I'm a native Hawaiian.  I've been married for 42 years to the same woman who also was raised in Hawaii.  I founded Local Motion surf company & other companies and now am a Realtor who knows Hawaiian real estate, history & culture better than any realtor that I know. I have visited ALL the islands in Hawaii & have many Realtor on each island if you're interested in buying real estate there.

name: Simply Suite in the Heart of Waikiki-free parking
host_about:
Aloha!  My name is Rustin Smith, and hopefully I’ll be your host during your stay in Honolulu!  

I am married to the the love of my life, a beautiful Japanese national and we have three beautiful daughters.  

I am originally from Alaska.  I am the 3rd child of 3. Older brother and older sister!  I grew up as a small town country boy doing the usual hunting and fishing with my father. He was a bush pilot and so I was able to experience most of the Alaskan Wilderness! 

We raised pigs and chickens, turkeys and ducks, also had a horse and a bunch of dogs and cats!  I played Hockey my entire childhood and loved every minute of it!  I’m kinda a golfer now though!!

After high school, I joined the United States Navy and was stationed in Pearl Harbor, Hawaii. After my time in the Navy I stayed in Hawaii and became a self made entrepreneur. I opened my first retail store in Waikiki at the age of 21.  I have opened 2 more locations since then and have been in the customer service industry for 20+years!

I just recently purchased a condo and would like to share my outstanding customer service skills to any and all potential travelers coming to our beautiful state of Hawaii.   

If there is anything that you need, I am at your service and I hope that you chose me as your host. I promise to do my best and to make your stay a memorable one!  

Mahalo!

name: 1Bdm- condo-Ocean View Kapaa-WM Resort
host_about:
Like you, I love to travel, including cruising. I love to help people. I love to be hospitable. I love to read, especially about the places I am about to visit in my travels and adventures.  My husband and I have visited most of the European countries, north and south, as well as: Turkey, Israel, Greece. Southeast Asia, and the Western Rockies of the United States and Western Canada. We have also visited the western shores of South America.

"What you know is a function of whom you choose to believe." This is my husband's (Ph.D.) saying. Of course, I believe it.

I just retired after thirty (30) years with one company. Now, I am enjoying sharing our  luxurious vacation resort (which has properties around the world and within the USA). Name any place on this globe, and I will try to help you make your dream vacation or travel experience come true. 

I am looking forward to hearing from you.

Thank you,

Lorie

name: 海を見下ろすアウトドアリビングのあるお部屋
neighborhood_overview:
There is a Food Mart ”Matsuyama Food Mart” just a minute's drive away where you can buy food, drinks and hot deli items. 15 minutes to Kona Town, 5 minutes to Makalei Golf Course, 15 minutes to nearby beaches.
Waimea Town 45 minutes, Hilo 100 minutes. And it is easy to get to everywhere you want to go.
host_about:
東京生まれの東京育ち｡39歳の時にハワイ島に移住してきました。ハワイ島は自然豊かでたくさんのたのしみがあります。ここに住む人々もとてもフレンドリーで親切です。ここでの生活は最高です。ハワイ島の素晴らしさをここを訪問する人々にも体験してほしいと思い、宿を始めました。この島の雄大さやたくさんの魅力を知っていただければと思います｡
また、小さなコーヒー農園でもあるので焙煎したてのコーヒーを飲んでいただいたり、季節のフルーツを食べていただいたりできるのもおすすめです。
主人のYoshiと高校生の息子Takumiの3人でみなさまをお迎えいたします。主人はツアーガイドをしているので、観光のアドバイスもできます。

name: Westin Nanea Resort 2 BR, 2 Bath Ka’anapali Beach
neighborhood_overview:
Ka'anapli Beach

The Boardwalk in Kaanapali is 1.5 miles, stretching past many hotels, restaurants, shopping, and condos. While walking the boardwalk, you may see whales breaching, parasailers, and people surfing, and beachgoers laying out. Along the path, you’ll find Whalers Village and other dining establishments. You can take a walk on the boardwalk at any time of day or night with your best views and most comfort at sunset and sunrise.

neighborhood_overview:
The property is gated and provides the convenience of reserved parking. The saltwater lap pool includes two whirlpools, changing rooms, and space to relax, surrounded by immaculately groomed grounds with an abundance of fragrant island foliage. You will also find a lovely covered community outdoor/picnic area, complete with gas grills. In addition, your rental includes an onsite 24-hour fitness center and a business center.

Beaches, shops, restaurants, bars, and many other amenities are within short walking distance. Across the street, you will find the Hilton Waikoloa Village with a spa, shopping, nine restaurants, and the Dolphin Quest Learning Center. Also within walking distance are:

* Marriotts newly refurbished Waikoloa Beach Resort & Spa
* A-Bay (a white sand beach, named one of Hawaii's finest beaches with great snorkeling and frequent sea turtle sightings)
* petroglyph trails

name: Hale Piko #2:  500 ft./1 min. walk to the beach!
neighborhood_overview:
Wai'anae is located approximately 28 miles (40-60 minutes depending on rush hour traffic) west of Daniel K. Inouye International Airport on the Leeward Coast, or the west side of the island. Wai'anae is a city in Honolulu County on the island of 'Oahu with a population of approximately 13,000, 80% being Native Hawaiian, Pacific Islander, or two or more ethnicities. A quick 15-minute drive without traffic to Ko'Olina Resort beach lagoons, Paradise Cove Luau, and Ko'Olina's PGA Golf Course.

Wai'anae is a close-knit community, and hometown to familiar faces such as actor Jason Momoa, MMA fighter Max Holloway, and Influencer Bretman Rock. This town is the countryside with a feel for old Hawai'i, the truly local impression offering some of the most beautiful beaches on the island, largest pod of spinner dolphins on the coastline, and beautiful sunsets. Though, like all beautiful places where everyone wants to be, we do experience traffic. The rush hour begins at 3:00pm going int
host_about:
Our rental is a veteran-owned & operated business. I am a local who grew up in Wai'anae, Hawai'i, and my husband is very familiar with our Leeward Coast beaches due to his current occupation. I’ve worked for a large hospitality corporation as a Business Development Rep. for 17 years and I am now also a returning student. 

We love to travel and know what to expect from our vacation rental experiences and want you to have the best stay possible, so please don't hesitate to message us if you have any questions. We'll be up-front and honest based on what you're expecting for your vacation. We look forward to hosting you!

name: Studio Room in Lahaina
host_about: Hi! My husband and I own several weeks at various Marriott locations, and we now offer many of those weeks to you! We want to share some of our family's favorite vacation spots in hopes that others will be able to enjoy them and create lasting memories. Each location boasts a private room at a resort, with staff to help you during your stay. Please reach out if you have any questions.

name: Entire 2 Bedroom Condo at Kona Hawaiian Resort
host_about: Hello! After many years of vacation club and property ownership, we have had the opportunity to appreciate how extremely convenient and comfortable these style stays can be for all types of travel. As our family has grown, we've found that we have more than we need and are able to utilize every year which lead us to start offering our properties at a great deal to others! With years of experience, our knowledge has allowed us to help others enjoy their vacations and make life long memories. We've been able to grow the services we offer into a business that now also manages multiple different owners with various types of ownerships!  We are happy to be in a place where we can help both owners and vacationers, so don't hesitate to ask for what you need - even if it is not directly listed! We can often book multiple units and/or offer nearby locations. Booking multiple condos at one of our resorts is one of our favorite ways to get family and friends together. Whether you are celebrating or simply spending time together with friends or family, book with us for your next vacation -  Traveling only expands one's horizons!

name: Spacious Princeville Two Bedroom Condo!  Ka Eo Kai
Westin Ka’anapali Ocean Resort 1-Bedroom
host_about:
After spending the past 24 years in Southern California, my wife Marie Claude and I are now settled in Provence part of the year and return to our second home in San Diego for several months each year.
We would be pleased to host you for a month when we travel to France in our comfortable duplex 2-bedroom conveniently located in the University Town Center of La Jolla, San Diego, or for a week in our luxury 2-bedroom, 1-bedroom or studio timeshare at the Westin Ka'anapali Ocean Resort in Maui.

neighborhood_overview:
Shopping, dining and entertainment 2 miles from the resort (no sidewalks)
